loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de 40 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora. Tiene una casa propia en la cual vive junto a su conviviente Pedro, quien se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de plátano, yuca, naranjas, limones, etc. Sus hijos ya son independientes, cada quien vive en su propia casa.
El trabajo  de María consiste  en la venta de hojas secas de “Shebón” que es un tipo de palmera; que se usa como techos para casas en las comunidades y  también en los galpones para la crianza de pollos. Realiza la venta de estas hojas en el frontis de su vivienda propia. Se inicio en este negocio porque en el fundo de  su vecino había abundantes palmeras de “Shebón” entonces  tuvo la idea generar dinero vendiendo estas hojas, que son solicitadas por los que crían pollos. Esta actividad lo realiza en sociedad con su vecino quien le brinda las hojas a un precio bajo y lo revende a sus clientes. Lleva 4 años en este negocio. Comenta que su actividad es rentable porque en este tiempo aumentado el consumo de pollo, esto hace que los granjeros construyan más galpones y esto incrementa su venta de hojas. Antes de iniciar esta actividad económica  no tenía el capital suficiente para aperturar un negocio propio, ayudaba a su conviviente en la agricultura, hasta lograr tener un capital de respaldo.  Desea permanecer en este negocio  e incrementar sus ventas, extraer abundantes hojas para abastecer a sus clientes y generar más ganancias económicas. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP, está agradecida porque le dan la oportunidad de seguir adelante en su actividad económica, se siente bien en su grupo ya que todo son ambles y respetuosos. 
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, lo utilizará como capital  para su negocio y también comprará herramientas para la extracción de estas hojas de shebón como machetes, hachas, palas, botas, etc. Con la ayuda de estos materiales  podrá extraer más hojas e incrementara su ganancia.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old; she is a cheerful and enterprising woman. She has her own house where she lives together with her partner Pedro, who works in agriculture planting plantains, cassava, oranges, limes, etc. Her children are already independent; each one lives in their own house. 

María’s work consists of selling dried “Shebón” leaves, which is a type of palm that’s used as roofs for houses in the communities, and also in sheds for raising chickens. She carries out her sales of these leaves in front of her own home. She started out in this business because there were abundant Shebón palms on her neighbor’s farm; then, she had the idea to earn money selling these leaves, which were sought after by those who raised chickens. She does this work in partnership with her neighbor, who offers her the leaves at a low price; she then resells them to her customers. 

She’s been in this business for 4 years. She says that her work is profitable because in these times, consumption of chicken is increasing. This causes the farmers to build more sheds, and this increases her sales of leaves. Before beginning this work, she did not have the sufficient capital to open her own business. She helped her partner with agriculture until she had enough support capital. 

She wishes to stay in this business and increase her sales, removing plenty of leaves to supply her customers and generate more economic earnings. Therefore, this will be her 5th loan with the organization MFP. She is grateful because they give her the opportunity to get ahead in her work. She feels good in her group, since they are all kind and respectful. 

With the requested loan of 2000 soles, she will use it as capital for her business; also, she will purchase tools for the removal of these Shebón leaves, such as machetes, axes, shovels, and boots, etc. With the aid of these materials, she will be able to remove more leaves and her earnings will increase.

loans.use: to purchase machetes, axes, shovels, and boots.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Kuña Guapa,  gracias a su trabajo y ayuda mutua está saliendo adelante y ya está en su tercer ciclo.  Elsa es miembro de este grupo y comenta que se dedica a la costura y que gracias a su esfuerzo ayuda a su familia y está saliendo adelante.
Elsa todos los días trabaja mucho desde muy tempranas horas del día ya que gracias a sus clientes siempre tiene mucho trabajo. Su deseo es poder seguir trabajando y dando fuente de trabajo a otras personas.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, para poder cumplir con sus pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The committee named “Kuña Guapa” is in its third loan cycle. Thanks to the work its members have accomplished and the assistance they provide each other, the group has been able to move forward.

Elsa is a member of this group and says that she works as a seamstress. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to help her family get ahead. Elsa works hard every day and begins her work in the early morning hours. Thanks to her customers, she always has plenty of work to do. Her wish is to continue working and provide jobs to other people.

Elsa is requesting a loan so that she can buy fabric, thread, rubber, buttons, and other supplies in order to complete her existing orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, rubber, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: 3 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
Las 11 integrantes de este grupo son de la ciudad de Caacupé, son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que se esfuerzan por dar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
Una de ellas es Mirtha, quien vende leche, y ella nos comenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ya que tiene que dejar su producto bien temprano en la casa de sus clientes para poder servirlos para el desuno. Desea poder seguir trabajando y creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual quiere poder surtirse y seguir dando un buen producto a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 11 members of this group are from the city of Caacupé. They are hardworking and enterprising individuals. These women are the heads of their families, so they strive to provide everything their children need so that they do not have to live a deprived life.

Mirtha, one of the members, sells milk. She says that she works every day and begins her duties in the early morning hours. Mirtha says that she must leave extremely early so that she can deliver her product to the homes of her customers in time for breakfast. She wants to continue working, growing, and helping her family.

Mirtha is requesting a loan in order to buy milk. She wants to be stocked so that she can continue providing a good product to her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Nerva

texts.es: Nerva de 29 años,  es una mujer alegre y soñadora. Ella Vive en su casa propia junto a su conviviente Octavio y a sus 4 hijos que están en etapa escolar. El trabajo de Nerva consiste en la venta de carne de res, que es  donde ofrece sus productos derivados del ganado vacuno como lomo fino,  bisteck, hígado, patitas, pierna, entre pierna, bofe,  entre otros. Cuenta con la ayuda de su conviviente quien la acompaña cada mañana al Camal  Municipal  para adquirir el producto al por mayor. Tiene que madrugar ya que hay varios compradores y si llega tarde encuentra a los revendedores quienes ofrecen la carne a un mayor precio.  Se inició en este negocio porque un vecino le cedió su puesto en el mercado y desde ese momento se dedica a este negocio. Comenta que su actividad económica es rentable  ya que en el mercado donde está acuden personas de toda la ciudad que adquieren diariamente este producto. Los que tienen restaurantes llevan en mayor volumen y pagan buen precio. Al comienzo tenia problemas económicos, no contaba con el dinero suficiente para emprender un negocio propio. Entonces realizo un préstamo  y lo utilizó como capital para su negocio.  Espera seguir creciendo, tener su propia ganadería, para incrementar sus ganancias económicas. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP, tiene muchas ganas de seguir siendo una socia puntual. Además sabe que el grupo del cual es parte son personas responsables y se apoyan mutuamente. Esta agradecida con la institución por ayudarle a crecer en su negocio propio. Con el monto solicitado  2000 soles, lo utilizará para comprar utensilios para su trabajo como cuchillos, hachas,  afiladores, mandiles, etc. Esta muy contenta porque podrá dar mejor atención a sus clientes  y contará con todas la herramientas necesarias para su negocio.
texts.en:
Nerva is 29 years old, a very happy woman, and a dreamer. She lives in her own house along with her partner, Octavio, and their four school-age children. Nerva's work consists of selling beef. She offers products derived from cattle, such as sirloin, steak, liver, hooves, legs, and others. She has the support of her partner, who accompanies her each morning to the Municipal Slaughterhouse where she buys the product in bulk. Nerva has to rise early because there are several buyers and if she arrives late she will find people reselling the meat at a higher price.

Nerva started this business because a neighbor passed on her stand in the market and from that moment on, she has been dedicated to this business. Nerva comments that her business is profitable, as people from all over the city come to the market where she is located and purchase her products daily. Those customers who own restaurants buy in greater volume and pay a better price.

At first, Nerva had economic problems. She did not have sufficient funds to launch her own business. Then, she took out a loan and used it as capital for her business. She hopes to keep growing and to own her own cattle in order to increase her profits. This will be her twelfth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has a great desire to continue being a punctual communal bank member. She also knows that the others in her group are responsible people and they mutually support one another. She is grateful for the help with growing her business. With the requested 2,000 nuevos soles, Nerva will buy tools for her work such as knives, axes, grinders, aprons, etc. She is very happy because she will be able to better serve her customers and will have the necessary tools for her business.

loans.use: to buy knives, axes, grinders and aprons

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Placido

texts.es: Placido de 37 años, es un hombre amable y emprendedor. Vive en su casa propia junto a su conviviente Leydith, quien trabaja en la municipalidad de su ciudad. Tiene 4 hijos a quienes desea darles una buen educación. El trabajo de Placido consiste en venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos. Harina, aceite, etc. su actividad económica lo realiza en un local que esta en el interior de su propia vivienda.  Se inició en este trabajo por la necesidad de las personas de su barrio; porque para comprar algún producto tenían que ir hasta la ciudad. Entonces tuvo la idea de construir un local  y dedicarse a la venta de estos productos. Realiza este trabajo junto a su  conviviente que es su socia, ya que  el  sueldo que le pagan en la municipalidad lo invierte en el negocio familiar. Comenta que su negocio es rentable porque  tiene muchos clientes y el lugar donde esta su local es accesible a toda la gente de su barrio. Antes de iniciar su negocio no contaba con el dinero suficiente, tenia el local construido pero vació. Entonces  decidió alquilar un motocarro para hacer taxi y juntar dinero para tener el capital necesario para inaugurar su negocio. Espera seguir creciendo en su actividad económica y  surtir con variables productos su negocio. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 3  con la institución  MFP, esta muy animado por que tiene un capital de respaldo  para su actividad económica. Esto lo motiva seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas con la institución. Con el monto solicitado  3000 lo invertirá comprando  abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, menestras, entre otros. También  comprara pintura para pintar su local, tener una mejor infraestructura  y  dar buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Placido is 37 years old. He is a friendly and enterprising man. He lives in his own house, along with his partner, Leydith, who works for the city government. They have four children who Placido hopes to provide with a good education. Placido's work is selling staple goods like rice, sugar, milk, eggs, flour, oil, etc. He sells these goods in a store that is located inside his home. He started this work because the people in his neighborhood needed it. Before, in order to buy something they had to go into the city. Then he had the idea to build a store and to dedicate himself to selling products. He performs this work together with Leydith, who is his partner, and she invests her salary from the city in the family business. Placido comments that his business is profitable because he has many customers and because his store is located such that it is accessible to the entire neighborhood.

Before he started this business, Placido did not have the money he needed. He had the storefront built but it was empty. Then he decided to rent a car to use as a taxi, and he saved up the capital he needed to open his store. He hopes to continue growing his business and to stock it with a variety of products. This will be his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP). He is very happy to have the backup capital he needs for his business. He is motivated to continue being punctual with his repayments to MFP. With the requested 3,000 nuevos soles, he will invest in buying groceries like rice, sugar, milk, eggs, dried vegetables and other products. He will also buy paint in order to paint his store, improve the infrastructure and to better serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, dried vegetables and other items

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 34 años, es una mujer amable y  entusiasta. Vive en su propia casa junto a su conviviente Gil y de sus 2 hijos, a quienes tratan  de darles una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida. Por eso los instan  que sigan estudiando y culminen sus estudios para lograr sus metas trazadas en la vida. El trabajo de Sonia consiste en la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, harina, aceite, huevos entre otros. Esta actividad económica lo realiza en un pequeño  local que esta en el interior de su vivienda. Lleva 07 años en éste trabajo y se inició en esta actividad por la necesidad de empleo y ayudar con los gastos diarios a su conviviente. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos en las tardes para la atención a las personas que adquieren sus productos, su conviviente la ayuda con las compras transportándola a los lugares donde están los mayoristas donde adquiere su mercadería a menor precio y así obtiene ganancias positivas en su negocio.  Comenta que su actividad es rentable porque vende productos de primera necesidad y todos los días tiene clientes. Al comenzar su negocio tenía problemas económicos  y por eso le parecía imposible emprender en éste negocio, pero por la aprobación de un préstamo solicitado obtuvo la oportunidad de surgir y salir adelante en su trabajo. Espera poder seguir creciendo, construir un local  más amplio con todo lo necesario para la buena recepción y atención de sus clientes. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 09 con la institución MF, le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal, porque las personas quienes la conforman son amigables, responsables y se apoyan mutuamente. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles lo utilizará para abastecerse de abarrotes en general tales como arroz, azúcar, harina, aceite, huevos entre otros. Desea  contar con los productos requeridos por  sus clientes, para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Sonia is 34 years old and a friendly and enthusiastic woman. She lives at home with her life partner and two children. She tries her hardest to offer them a good education and quality of life. This is why she encourages them to continue studying in order to fulfill their future goals. Sonia works in a small grocery store where she sells items such as rice, sugar, flour, oil, eggs, etc. Her small grocery store is located within her home. She has been working in this grocery store for 7 years now and started it for financial needs to pay household expenses. Her children help her work in the afternoons to attend customers. Her partner helps her stock up on merchandise. He helps by taking her wholesale shopping to make a profit by selling retail. She mentions that her business is profitable because she sells essential items and has clientele everyday. In the beginning she had problems starting her business finding it impossible to do so. However, with a loan request she was able succeed with her business. She hopes to continue to grow and build a larger store stocked with more items to satisfy her customers. At the moment, this will be her 9th loan with the MF Institution. She likes being a part of her communal bank because the members are friendly, responsible, and offer mutual support. She is requesting a 2500 Peruvian soles loan to stock up her grocery store with items such as rice, sugar, flour, oil, eggs, etc. She hopes to offer her clients what they need in order to make a profit.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, flour, oil, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркул 46 лет,проживает с мужем. Анаркул родилась в простой и многодетной семье фермера, с детства была самостоятельным ребенком и помогала матери по уходу за домом. Анаркул получила среднее образование в школе. С мужем они воспитали детей, троих прекрасных девочек.По характеру Анаркул очень жизнерадостная добрая и честная женщина. Муж Анаркул помогает ей по хозяйству и свободное время предоставляет услуги ремонта автомобилей.С 2000 года Анаркул начала заниматься животноводством. Их начальный капитал составлял 8,400 сом(KGS) они закупили 8 овец. Благодаря их трудолюбию и целеустремленности на сегодняшний день у них в хозяйстве имеется две коровы, один теленок и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход семьи составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Анаркул обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)на покупку овец и теленка. За счет доходов от полученного кредита планируют увеличить поголовье скота и соответственно улучшить условия жизни.
texts.en:
Anarkul is 46 years old and lives with her husband.  She was born into a simple farming family with many children, and from the time she was small she was very independent and helped her mother run the household.  She has a high school education.  Together with her husband, she has raised three wonderful daughters.  Anarkul is a very kind, cheerful and honest woman.  Her husband helps her around the house and in his spare time he works as a mechanic.  

Since the year 2000, Anarkul has begun to raise and sell livestock.  Their starting capital was 8,400 som (KGS), with which they bought eight sheep.  Thanks to their hard work and diligence, they now have two cows, one calf and ten sheep on their farm.  Their monthly income is approximately 15,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of increasing her head of livestock in the future, Anarkul has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a calf and some sheep.  With the proceeds from this loan, she plans on increasing the size of her herd so she can in turn improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and sheep

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel de 57 años, es un hombre amable y  esforzado. Vive  en su casa propia junto a  su conviviente Flor quien se dedica a los que haceres del hogar. Tienen un hijo de 14 años que esta en el colegio a quien quieren dar una buena educación. El trabajo de Ángel consiste  en la construcción  de galpones para la crianza de pollos, esta construcción lo realiza con listones de un árbol maderable conocido como “Quinilla”, los cuales utiliza como “soporte” (una especie de columna pero de madera), y para el techado de estos galpones  usa  hojas secas de una especie de palmera conocida como Shebón. Este trabajo lo realiza en distintos lugares donde lo soliciten. Comenta  que se Inicio en esta labor, junto a un amigo que es un experto en construcción de galpones, quien le propuso que fuera su ayudante y desde ese tiempo trabajan como socios. Ahora acaba de firmar un contrato con una empresa que solicita la construcción pronta de 10 galpones. Lleva 21 años en este rubro, considera rentable lo que hace ya que cada vez hay más criadores de pollos y solicitan sus servicios porque tiene buenas referencias de sus clientes por los trabajos realizados. Al iniciar  esta actividad tenía problemas  económicos y no podía comprar las herramientas que necesitaba, esto lo limitaba  en su actividad laboral y ahora espera permanecer en este trabajo para seguir teniendo solvencia económica. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 10 con la institución  MFP, esta muy animado y quiere seguir siendo puntual. Está agradecido con la institución ya que gracias aun préstamo anterior pudo adquirir  herramientas para su labor. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles comprará herramientas para su trabajo tales como, serrucho, martillo, machete, brocas, alicates, etc. Para que le faciliten la construcción de galpones y obtener ganancias en menor tiempo.
texts.en: Ángel is 57 years old and a friendly and hardworking man. He lives at home with his partner Flor who helps around the house. They have a 14 year old son who is in high school and they want to offer him a good education. Ángel works in constructing chicken coops. He builds them with wooden fiber known as "Quinilla" for support (a column made of wood). He uses leaves from a palm tree known as Shebón for the roof. He builds the coops in different places depending on where is is called. He comments that he began in this business with a friend who is an expert in building chicken coops. He was asked to be an assistant and since then they worked as partners. Now he signed a contract with a company that requested the construction of 10 chicken coops. He has been working in this business for 21 years. He considers this job to be profitable since he makes more and more chicken coops and is called upon frequently due to positive references. He had financial difficulties starting this business and could not afford the tools he needed. This limited his work but now he expects to stay in this business to continue making money. At the moment, this will be his 10th loan with the MFP Institution. He is very enthusiastic and wants to continue being punctual. He is thankful for the institution since he was able to get a loan from them to acquire the tools he needed to work. He plans on using the 2000 Peruvian soles loan to buy tools such as a saw, hammer, machete, drills, clippers, etc to build chicken coops and make profits.

loans.use: buy a saw, hammer, machete, drills, clippers, etc

loans.name: Aklimo

texts.ru: Прекрасная домохозяйка хочет поменять образ жизни и стать успешной бизнес леди. Ее зовут Аклимо. Ей 40 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 6 детей. Она старается успевать по всем делам, и по введении хозяйства и воспитанием детей и еще организовать свой бизнес. Ее муж восхищается такой женой, но он не в состоянии обеспечить жену и детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Аклимо имеет куры и обеспечивает детей яйцами, но одними яйцами ей не справляться. Она должна их обеспечить маслом, молочными продуктами, мясом, а также одеждой и образованием. Итак, она срочно должна организовать бизнес и получать доход. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A wonderful homemaker wants to change her way of live and become a successful businesswoman.  Her name is Aklimo.  She is 40 years old and is married with six children at home.  She does her best to stay on top of everything, from running her household to raising her children and also to starting her own business.  Her husband admires her, but he is not in a position to provide for her and the children's needs.  Aklimo has chickens which give the children eggs, but there is not even one egg left for her.  She should be able to give her children butter, dairy products and meat as well as clothing and education.  This is why she urgently needs to start her business and earn an income.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Get Ahead" course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Now she is fully capable of starting her own business and becoming successful in that sphere.  She wants to start her business buying and selling livestock, as she has experience in this type of work.  With the income from her business, Aklimo plans on giving her children a good education and high-calorie foods.  She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni with which to buy livestock to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Sakinakhon

texts.ru: Сакинахон жительница города Исфара. Она продолжает свою деятельность. Также Сакинахон занимается оптовой реализацией сухофруктов (кураги). Она берет еще один кредит для покупки сухофруктов.
texts.en: Sakinakhon lives in the city of Isfara.  She is continuing her business, which also includes selling dried apricots wholesale.  She is asking for another loan to buy dried fruits.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 52 years old, is married and has three children. He does livestock farming to earn a living and has been farming for four years. Boniface has employed two people in his business. He also will operate a transport business in the future. 
 
Boniface hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. He has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy two heifers.

loans.use: To buy two heifers

loans.name: Zinat

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Зинат является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Ее муж не в состоянии обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Зинат  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как лук, морковь, арбуз и т.п. Ее муж будет помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует женить своих детей, а также обеспечить их с хорошими условиями жизни. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  3000 сомони для покупки семена и минеральных удобрений, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Difficult living conditions make a person use all their strength and motivate their existing resources.  Zinat is one of those people - someone who is trying to improve her living conditions and stimulate the economic status of her family.  She is married with five children at home.  Her husband is not in a position to provide for his family's needs, so Zinat decided to help her husband for the good of her family.  With that goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  She wants to start her own farming business growing onions, carrots, watermelons, etc.  Her husband will help her run this business.  With the income from this business, she plans to marry off her children as well as provide good living conditions for them.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer so she can start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for organizing new business

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has six children and has been doing this work for 19 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, crops, and her personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Gardening!' Her biggest challenge is 'Crop diseases'. She will use the loan to construct a dairy unit.

Lonah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Lower interest.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'I can develop myself through their funding.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how will this loan benefit her family, Lonah replied that the 'sale of milk will assist in paying school fees.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lonah owns the following: 'cow, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a 'TV' but does not have 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has one child and has been doing this work for four years.  Her primary income sources are milk, crops, and her personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is feeding animals since it translates into good production: Her biggest challenges are 'dairy animal diseases and market for horticulture products.'

Sandra was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Low interest rates compared to others.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Asset acquisition and profitability.'

Her highest monthly expense are family expenses. When asked how will this loan benefit your family, Sandra replied, 'more income from milk.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Sandra owns the following: 'cow, pump, bicycle, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, poultry, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Oshurmo

texts.ru: Ошурмо 53 года. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Ошурмо очень трудолюбивая и жизни радостная женщина, которая всегда на мотивации. Она живет очень в трудных условиях, так как от мужа ей нечего не осталось. Она выросла своих детей одна и ей никто не помогал. Ее дети выросли, но до сих пор Ошурмо обеспечивает их сама. У нее расходы очень большие, надо женить старших, младшим надо дать образование. Кроме этого ежедневные расходы на питания, одежду, мобильный, транспорт, коммунальные расходы это все должна обеспечить Ошурмо. Для получения дохода она планирует организовать бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Этот займ поможет ей организовать бизнес. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим условием жизни. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Oshurmo is 53 years old.  She is a widow with four children, and she is a very hard-working and cheerful woman who is always motivated.  She faces difficult living conditions, as there is nothing left from her husband.  She raised her children alone without any help.  Her children are grown, but to this day Oshurmo takes care of them herself.  She has very large expenses, as she needs to pay for her eldest child's wedding and her youngest child's education.  Besides that, the everyday expenses for food, clothing, mobile phone bills, transport and utilities fall to Oshurmo.  

To increase her income, Oshurmo plans to start her own business.  With that goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Now she is fully capable of starting her own business and becoming successful in that sphere.  She wants to start her business buying and selling livestock, as she has experience in this type of work.  This loan will help her start her business.  With the income from her business, Oshurmo plans on providing her children with good living conditions.  She is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy livestock to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business

loans.name: Ravshangul

texts.ru: Равшангулу 50 лет. Она замужем на тракториста и имеет 5 детей. Она работает учительницей в школе и получает маленькую зарплату. Доход ее мужа тоже не позволяет обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Равшангул решила организовать свой бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ravshangul is 50 years old and she is married with five children.  Her husband drives a tractor and she works as a teacher in a school, but receives a small salary.  Her husband's income is also not enough to provide for their family's needs, so Ravshangul decided to start her own business for the good of her family.  With that goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Now she is fully capable of starting her own business and becoming successful in that sphere.  She wants to start a business buying and selling livestock.  With the income from this business, she plans to provide her children with a good education and high-calorie foods.  Ravshangul is asking for a loan of 2000 somoni to buy livestock to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business

loans.name: Afsar

texts.en:
Afsar is 43 years old. He is a married father of four children. It is the second loan of Asfar. He was very thankful to Kiva and lenders for a loan to help improve his business. But now he has a new business. Afsar has had this retail shop for two years. In order to improve his business and increase his monthly income, Asfar is requesting a loan of 1,700 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat) to buy products (detergents, shampoo, soap. etc.) for his shop.

Afsar is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli City, but now he lives and works in Kurdmahmudlu with his family.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru:
Тахмина очень добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 42 года и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Всю свою жизнь она посветила школе, то есть она учительница в средней школе. Она очень любит свою профессию и с удовольствием работает. Ее зарплата очень маленькая и с каждым годом экономическое состояние семьи ухудшается. Ее муж тоже не зарабатывает достаточно денег и поэтому Тахмина должна найти дополнительный источник дохода. Она умудрилась и решила организовать свой бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей скота.
Этот займ поможет ей организовать новый бизнес и таким образом открыть двери для экономического развития. Если условия жизни улучшится, то уют и радость тоже будет господствовать ее доме. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  3000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Tahmina is a very kind and goal-oriented woman.  She is 42 years old and has two children at home.  Her whole life she has shone a light on a school, which is to say that she is a high school teacher.  She loves her work very much and does it gladly, but her salary is very low and every year the economic situation of her family worsens.  Her husband also does not earn enough money to support the family, which is why Tahmina needed to find a source of income.  After much thought, she decided to start her own business.  With that goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Now she is fully capable of starting her own business and becoming successful in that sphere.  She wants to start her own business buying and selling livestock.  This loan will help her start her new business and it will also open the door to economic development.  If her living conditions improve, then comfort and joy will rule her house.  Tahmina is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy livestock to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business

loans.name: Annlyne

texts.en:
Annlyne lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has four children and has been farming for 12 years. Her primary income sources are selling milk and eggs, growing crops, and transportation services.

Annlyne indicated that what is most enjoyable about farming is  'earning from the sale of milk!' Her biggest challenge is 'diseases in livestock.' One of the animals on the farm is named 'Lelmet'.She will use the loan amount specifically to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Annlyne was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'from  a neighbour.'  She was also asked about what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to earn income from agriculture.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Annlyne replied, 'increased income to the family.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Annlyne owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Annlyne has the following items in her household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD player'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and to send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.ru:
Нусрат более двенадцати лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит мелко - рогатый и крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Нусрат разводит скот у себя дома. На сегодняшний день у него 10 голов крупнорогатого и 12 голов мелко - рогатого скота. В продвижении его дела ему помогают его дети. 
Нусрат 47 летний женатый мужчина. У него семеро детей. Двое его сыновей находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. 
Нусрат берет кредит для закупа бычков и быков.
texts.en:
Nurat has worked in animal husbandry for more than 12 years. He raises sheep, goats, and cattle for future sale on his property. He currently has 10 goats and sheep as well as 10 heads of cattle. 

Nurat is a 47-year-old married man with seven children. His children help him with his work. Though, two of his sons work in the Russian Federation. He would like this loan to purchase steer and bulls.

loans.use: to purchase steer and bulls

loans.name: Akzyinat

texts.ru: Акзыйнат 40 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей . Акзыйнат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, 8 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый с суммы 5,000 KGS бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Акзыйнат, на сегодня насчитывает 2 доеные коровы, 2 теленка, 30 голов овец и коз, 1 лошадь и приносит доход около 5,000 сом в месяц с продажи молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Акзыйнат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку доеных коров. Что позволит увеличить продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Иззатой планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса  и как поделилась она планирует купить машину.
texts.en:
Akzyinet is a 40-year-old married mother of five. As her family's main income provider, Akzyinet began working in animal husbandry eight years ago. She began her business with 5,000 som and thanks to hard work and persistence, today she owns two dairy cows, two calves, 30 sheep and goats, and one horse. Her dairy sales bring in about 5,000 som a month. 

With long-term business development in mind, Akzyinet turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som to purchase two dairy cows. The addition of these cows would increase her milk sales. She plans to invest the income from the loan in her business and to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Umedi

texts.ru: Умед проживает в районе Вахш. Ему 24 года. Он холост. Живет вместе с отцом. Отец Умеда работает таксистом. Умед сам занимается скотоводством. Он уже пять лет как разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Умед берет кредит для закупа бычков с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Umedi lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 24 years old and single. He lives with his father, who is a taxi driver. 

Umedi works in animal husbandry. He has been raising cattle for future sale for five years now. He would like this loan to purchase steer with the goal of increasing his head of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. He has one child.

He is a farmer and has been doing this work for four years. His primary income sources are eggs and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry keeping!" His biggest challenge is "Expensive poultry feeds and poultry diseases." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Maua." He will use the loan to buy more poultry birds.

Jeremiah was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Because Juhudi Kilimo offers loans for small scale farmers to improve their lives."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "They are short-term loans given to small-scale farmers and businesses by financial institutions."

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Jeremiah replied, "Money from the poultry and its products will help to gather for family expenses."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jeremiah owns the following: poultry, bicycle, motorcycle, but does not own cow, pig, pump or automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net and TV but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has three children.

He is a farmer and has been doing this work for six years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Gardening!" His biggest challenge is "transporting produce to the market." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "white udder."

He will use the loan to buy materials for setting up a greenhouse, mainly for growing tomatoes.

Samwel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Because of the efficiency in loan disbursements." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "How to do farming as a business."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Samwel replied, "Improved quality of life."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Samwel owns the following: cow, poultry, bicycle, but does not own pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a Nissan with which he provides transport to passengers and businesspeople. His business is located at a viable location and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his eight family members. 

His business goal is to run a new business of rental houses within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous one of KES 70,000 he managed to pay well.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has four children.

He is a farmer and has been doing this work for seven years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry!" His biggest challenge is "cost of poultry feeds." The animals in the farm are not named.

He will use the loan to buy poultry birds.

Stephen was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "fair interest rates."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "Business record keeping."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Stephen replied, "Children will go to better schools."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Stephen owns the following: cow, poultry, but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net, TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis is a 50-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 3 years to 11 years. He describes himself as a hardworking man. 

He operates a photography business where he takes photographs and sells them to customers. His business is located at a viable location and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp, which will be used by his family members. 

His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 50,000 he managed to pay.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 29-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as a principled man. 

He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, home products, maize flour, cooking fat, etc. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located at a strategic business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. 

He will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp that will be used by his family members. 

His business goal is to expand his business to a wholesale/retail store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy land for his family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Annaly

texts.en:
Annaly is a 28 year old married woman and a mother of four young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. 

She has been in the seaweed farming business for more than two years now, together with her husband.
 
Annaly is asking for a loan to buy materials for seaweed farming such as seaweed seedlings, rope, straw and others. With this, she will be able to increase their seaweed farming.

In the future, Annaly hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for seaweed farming such as seaweed seedlings, rope and straw.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 66-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 19 years to 33 years. She describes herself as determined and ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes and shoes. Her business is located at a viable location and her primary customers are local residents. In addition, Ruth sells vegetables and fruits, which increases her business income. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her seven family members. 

Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is 31 years and married with three children whose ages range from three to seven. For the past 13 years, he has been a farmer who sells his produce and he also works as a mason. Bonface's business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve his business. 

Bonface is requesting a 12,900 KES loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by his family members . His business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Bephley

texts.en:
Bephley is 33 years old and married with four children whose ages range from three to 13. She describes herself as optimistic. Bephley operates a business where she provides maize grinding services and sells maize flour. Her business is located in a strategic business area and her primary customers are local residents. Bephley's biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve her business. 

Bephley is requesting a 5,800 KES loan to buy a solar lamp that will be used by her six family members. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Zuwela

texts.en:
Zuwela is 24 years old and married with three children. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Zuwela operates a timber-selling business which is located in a strategic business area and her primary customers are local residents. Her major business challenge is insufficient funds to improve her business. 

Zuwela is requesting a 5,800 KES loan to buy a solar lamp that will be used by her family. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ferahim

texts.en: Ferahim is 22 years old. Ferahim lives in the Fizuli region with his parents, but he was an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) person from Fizuli town. Now Ferahim needs 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy spare parts for his work, so he can do innovation in his work. He loves his work. It was a new business for Ferahim. He needs loan to improve business and to get more products for his shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy land for Josius to begin his own coffee farm.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 53 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 30 and 25. In 2000, she established her woodcarving business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy wood and timber. In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy wood for her woodcarving business.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood and cereals. Her business is located at a strategic business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 5,800 Kes (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a solar lamp, which will be used by her family members for lighting the house during the night. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 33 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 6. In 2000, she established her woodcarving business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy wood and timber. In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buys wood for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 42-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be a focused and hardworking woman. She operates a retail business where she sells maize flour that she grinds. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to improve the business. 

She will use the 21,000 Kes (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baby goats that he will feed and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is a shrewd and hardworking young man of 27 years. He started welding immediately after he dropped out of school five years ago due to lack of school fees, and helped fund school fees for his siblings, who were still in primary school. Through hard work, he has managed to educate two of his siblings and two relatives with whom he works at the welding workshop. 

He is building his first residential house, which will help him find enough space to live with his family as well as some relatives since it has been costly to rent. He commends Ugafode for the good job of helping the poor to also access loans, unlike in commercial banks, where the procedures are long and unfriendly. His previous loan was used on the same house, and he hopes that with this loan he will be able to complete it and move in with his family. 

In the photo is Rogers (left) with a Ugafode staff member who consented to be published.

loans.use: To finish construction of his house.

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es:
Hilda originaria de Estelí, con 41 años de edad, acompañada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 8, 12 y 16 años, de oficio comerciante. Se dedica al servicio de molino. Inicio con capital propio, productos de sus ahorros, el cual es el servicio de molino que  le ofrece a sus clientes, ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, y  este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es ampliarlo, para darles mejor  atención  a sus clientes.
Hilda solicita el préstamo  para comprar otro molino. Ya que ella estima que le será de mucha ayuda porque asi podrá comprar  dos molino uno para moler masa y el otro para moler pinol (es una bebida típica que esta hecha a base de maíz), de esta manera le  podrá dar un mejor servicios a sus clientes, y asi incrementar sus ganancias. Sus  planes futuro  es hacerle mejora a su casa para tener mejor presentación en su negocio.
texts.en:
41-year old Hilda is a native of Estelí. She and her husband have three children aged 8, 12, and 16. Hilda is a businesswoman and runs a mill. She started out using her own savings. Her husband helps her with the business. This is her first business venture and she hopes to expand it so she can provide her customers with better service.

Hilda is seeking a loan to buy another mill; she believes it will be a great help. One mill will be used to grind corn and the other to grind pinol (to make a local drink based on corn). In this way she'll provide an improved service to her customers and increase her income. In the future she hopes to make improvements to her house which in turn will give a better impression of her business.

loans.use: Buy a second mill

loans.name: Eliecer

texts.es:
Eliecer originario de la Comarca San Nicolás, Municipio de Estelí, con 25 años, soltero, Estudiante universitario, de oficio comerciante. Inicio dando sus servicios de molino en la misma comunidad a sus clientes, ya que el dice que este ha sido un negocio familiar, el cual su padre le enseño, que ha venido de generación en generación, en el  cual el comenzó a trabajar a los 19 años de edad. Este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio, para darles una mejor atención a sus clientes y poder satisfacer sus necesidades.
Eliecer solicita el préstamo para la compra de un motor  y un asiento, etc. El considera que este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda, para poder atender más clientes y asi brindar un mejor servicio, de esta manera obtener   mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Eliecer is originally from the town of Estelí in the Comarca San Nicolás.  He is 25 years old, single, a university student, and works as a trader.  He began offering his services to his customers in his community as a grinder.  He says this work is familiar to him since his father taught it to him and it has come down from generation to generation.  He started this work at 19 years old.  This is his first business.  He expects to expand the business, provide better service to his customers, and be able to satisfy his needs.   

Eliecer is requesting this loan to purchase a motor and a seat.  He believes this loan will help him serve more customers and provide better service to be able to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase a motor and a seat.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José con 31 años de edad, casado, padre de 2 hijos, entre la edad de 1 y 3 años, de oficio comerciante.  El comenzó  trabajando para una empresa, la cual le dio un crédito para que estableciera su propio negocio como es la venta de ropa y zapatos ,del que es propietario hace mas de 3 años, el cual este ha sido su primer negocio ,con el que ha podido salir adelante con la ayuda de su esposa.
José solicita el préstamo para comprar  mas ropa, zapato, etc. ya que el considera que este préstamo le ayudaría a comprar toda la mercadería necesaria que necesita en inventario para poder vender mas y asi incrementar sus ganancias en su negocio, sus planes futuro es comprar un carro para salir a vender en los mercados de la ciudad, ya que sus metas próxima es ampliar su negocio y asi obtener mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, a 31 years old, married father of two children between the ages of one and three, is a merchant.  He started working for a company that gave him a loan to establish his own business selling clothes and shoes.  He has been a business owner for more than three years.  This has been his first business and, with it, he has been able to move forward, with help from his wife. 

Jose is requesting the loan to buy more clothes, shoes, etc. because the loan will help him buy all the necessary merchandise that he needs in inventory to be able to sell more and thus increase the profits from his business.  His future plan is to buy a car to go out to sell in the city’s markets because his next goal is to expand his business and thus obtain better income for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Wilmer Isaac

texts.es:
Wilmer originario de Estelí, con 22 años de edad, casado, de oficio comerciante. Inicio sin ninguna experiencia  cortando pelo a los jóvenes, pero con el tiempo le fue gustando este tipo de oficio y fue cuando decidió poner su propio negocio de barbería, el cual este ha sido su primer negocio, el cuenta con el apoyo de su papa, ya que sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio, para incrementar sus ganancias.
Wilmer solicita el crédito para comprar una silla de barbería, pistolas y planchas de cabello etc. Esto le ayudara a  instalar un salón de belleza. Ya que el considera que este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda, porque asi podrá surtir su barbería  con artículos de belleza,  que necesite en su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias, sus planes futuro es tener una casa propia  y establecer  otro negocio
texts.en:
Wilmer is originally from Estelí.  He is 22 years old and married.  He started with no experience cutting young people's hair, but in time he found he liked the work and decided to open his own barber shop.  It is his first business.  He has support from his father and hopes to expand his business to increase his income.  

Wilmer is requesting this loan to purchase a barber's chair, hair dryers, and hair straighteners.  This will help him start his salon.  He thinks that this loan will help him stock his barber shop with beauty products that his business needs to increase his income.  His plan for the future is to have his own home and establish another business.

loans.use: to purchase a barber's chair, hair dryers, and hair straighteners.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bed.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive con su familia en el distrito de Cayalti, ubicado a aproximadamente a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  

Se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza y venta de animales menores.  Los alimenta, los cría y engorda, y una vez que ya están en un peso y tamaño ideal los vende a los comerciantes y el mercado de la zona.  Herlinda junto con su esposo trabajan arduamente día a día para que con sus ingresos puedan darle lo mejor a su familia.  

Herlinda desea seguir crecienda.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.  Este dinero le permitirá comprar más animales para su posterior venta.

Herlinda cuenta con buenas referencias personales en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 41 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives with her family in the Cayalti district about one hour from the city of Chiclayo.  

She has worked raising and selling small animals for five years.  She feeds them so they grow and fatten, and when they are at the ideal weight and size, she sells them to merchants and at the market in her area.  Herlinda works hard every day together with her husband so that their income can give the best to their family.

Herlinda wants to continue growing, so she has decided to request a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This money will allow her to purchase more animals for later sale.  

Herlinda has good personal references from her community.

loans.use: to purchase animals for later sale.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es:
Venancio tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y vive con su familia en una casa que no es propia.  Esta casa está ubicada en el distrito de Cayalti, a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la crianza y venta de animales menores, él cría los animales en algunos corrales acondicionados cerca a su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Con estos ingresos se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Venancio desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de aves de corral de modo que su nivel de ventas se pueda ampliar durante los siguientes meses en los cuales su demanda aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles.

Venancio es bastante empeñoso y con ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder consolidar a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Venancio is 31 years old, common law married and lives with his family in a house that is not his own. This house is located in the district of Cayalti, 1 hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque.

He has earned a living for ten years by raising and selling small animals.  He raises the animals in some pens set up near his home.  When these animals have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the dealers that always visit the area where he lives.  With these earnings, he sees to the success of his family.  

Venancio wishes to expand his business with the purchase of poultry so that his level of sales can expand during the coming months when demand increases.  Thus he has seen fit to request a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  

Venancio is quite hard-working and he desires to get ahead.  His greatest desire is to continue growing as a business-owner in order strengthen his family.  The people that know him consider him a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: to buy poultry for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 62 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus abuelos en la zona urbana marginal del distrito de Mórrope,   una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Cuenta con servicios de  luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la crianza y comercio de animales, contando con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 20 años, cliente cuenta con gran inventario en aves de corral, teniendo patos, pavos medianos y grandes y gallinas, las cuales son vendidas una vez engordados.

Víctor ha solicitado un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.  El destino del crédito será para invertir en la puesta de techo de su casa y compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado.  

Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización
texts.en:
Victor is 62 years old, single and lives in his grandparents’ home in the marginal urban area in the district of Mórrope, which is a rural area that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is situated approximately an hour from the city of Chiclayo. There is electricity, and it  is a small community with approximately 100 families.
Victor’s business is raising and selling animals. He has more than 20 years of experience. He has a large inventory of poultry, as he has ducks, medium and large turkeys, and chickens that he sells once they have been fattened.
Victor is requesting a loan of 1500 new Peruvian soles. The loan will be used to invest in putting a roof on his house and to purchase animal feed for his livestock.
This business has competition, but it also has a large market.

loans.use: to put a roof on his home and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Jose Yvan

texts.es:
José tiene 22  años de edad, soltero, sin hijos. Vive en casa de abuelos propia en el Distrito de Tambogrande correspondiente al distrito a Piura ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Él ayuda en las tareas de la parcela y en la crianza de ovinos a sus abuelos. Comunidad alejada a unos  25 minutos de la ciudad y no cuenta con servicios básicos. 

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es el cultivo de limón y mango, así como también la crianza de ovinos, aves de corral. Se dedica al cultivo de limón y  a la crianza hace aproximadamente más de 2 años. Solicita crédito para el mantenimiento de cultivo y la compra de alimento balanceado para animales. Para eso cliente cuenta con los conocimientos para el manejo de sus cultivos y a la adecuada alimentación de animales.

José desea seguir creciendo en el negocio además de ofrecer productos de calidad.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old, single, and has no children. He lives in his grandparents’ own house in the district of Tambogrande, which is in the province of Piura and located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo. He helps work the land and raise his grandparents’ sheep. The community is 25 minutes away from a city and does not have basic services.
His business is the cultivation of lemons and mangos, as well as raising sheep and poultry. He has been working in the production of lemons and in livestock for about 2 years. He is requesting the loan to maintain the crop and to buy feed for the animals. José has knowledge on crop management and the adequate feeding of animals.
José desires to continue growing in the business and, in addition, to offer quality products. This is why he thought it would be good to obtain a loan of 1000 new Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to maintain his crop and to buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive en una comunidad en la zona urbana de Zaña, perteneciente a la provincia de Chiclayo.

Orlando se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros desde hace más de 5 años en su propio domicilio en base a pedidos.  Él compra sus telas al por mayor para que le den a buen precio.  Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad, Orlando es muy conocida en el rubro y ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles.  Con estos ingresos cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.

Orlando necesita comprar más telas para seguir confeccionando sus prendas de vestir para la venta.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Orlando es un joven empresario con muy buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Orlando is 26 years old, single and lives in a community in the urban area of Zaña, which is in the province of Chiclayo.
For over five years, Orlando has been making women’s and men’s clothing to order, based out of his own home. He buys his fabrics wholesale, so that they give him a good price. Due to the time he has spent working in this activity, Orlando is well-known in the area and has a group of loyal customers. With this income, he covers his expenses and those of his family.
Orlando needs to buy more fabrics to continue making his clothing for sale. This is why, in order to achieve his objective, he has requested a loan of 1000 new Peruvian soles.
Orlando is an entrepreneurial youth with lots of good personal references.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make clothes.

loans.name: Martas Group

texts.es: Doña Martha es miembro del Grupo Solidario Las Martas, tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de cinco hijos, es una persona trabajadora, amigable y emprendedora. Ella inicio su negocio desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, negocio con el que pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, se levanta a las 3:00 am a cocinar y sale a vender a las 9:00 am, el trabajo lo realiza todos los días y lo hace en conjunto con una de sus hijas, su principal desafío es salir a vender cuando esta lloviendo ya que ella no cuenta con un medio de transporte y los problemas del clima le afectan en las ventas diarias. Con el préstamo que doña Martha solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: harina, pollo, maíz tierno y seco, para poder cocinar sus golosinas. Con la ayuda de este préstamo ella podrá ofrecer mas golosinas a sus clientes y de esta forma tendrá mayores ventas y mejores ganancias que le ayuden al sustento de su familia. Su sueño es tener su propio local para ya no salir a vender de forma ambulante y que su negocio pueda estar ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para poder ahorrar cuando ella ya no pueda trabajar y así tener una vejez tranquila. Doña Martha es el segundo crédito que solicita en FAMA y ha pagado satisfactoriamente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the united group Las Martas.  She is 47 years old and is a single mother of five children.  She is a hard-working, friendly and entrepreneurial person.  She started her business 15 years ago.  She earns a living selling snacks, a business with which she can help her children get ahead.  She gets up at 3:00 a.m. to cook and at 9:00 a.m. she goes out to sell.  She works everyday and does it with one of her daughters.  Her main challenge is to go out to sell when it is raining since she does not have a means of transportation and problems with the weather affect her daily sales.  

With the loan Martha is requesting, she needs it to invest in the purchase of products such as flour, chicken, and corn (fresh and dried) in order to cook her snacks.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to offer more snacks to her customers and in this way she will have greater sales and better profits which will help her to support her family.  

Her dream is to have her own shop and not go out to do mobile sales and to be able to have her business located in the center of the city so that she can save for when she is no longer able to work and thus have a peaceful retirement.  Martha is the second loan requested from FAMA and they have satisfactorily made the payments [on the first one].

loans.use: to buy flour, chicken, and corn among other things.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comite Nuevo Horizonte es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 17 integrantes muy responsables, que se esfuerzan por poder cumplir con todos sus compromisos. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que día a día dan todo por sus familias.
Maria Cresencia vende carbón, y ella comenta que cada vez le está yendo mejor, pues la venta de carbón cada vez sube más, ya que es más barata. Maria Cresencia es una persona muy emprendedora, que desde siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante y ayudar a los suyos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carbón, con lo cual podrá seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes y teniendo surtido su negocio. Ella agradece por la gran oportunidad que estan recibiendo pues no solo ellas se ven beneficiadas, sino también sus familias.
texts.en:
The committee named “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) is in the city of San Lorenzo. This group has 17 responsible members who strive to fulfill all of their commitments. They are female heads of households and strive to provide everything for their families on a daily basis.

Maria Cresencia sells charcoal. She says that her business is doing much better each time because her sales increase as the price of charcoal goes lower. Maria Cresencia is an enterprising individual who always strives to move forward and help her family members. She is requesting a loan in order to buy charcoal so that she can complete her customers’ orders and stock her business.

Maria Cresencia is grateful for this wonderful opportunity that her group has received. Not only will the members benefit, but their families will also enjoy the results.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jose Manuel
