texts.es: José Manuel tiene la edad de 29 años, estudia la carrera de contabilidad pública y finanzas, empezó a trabajar a los 12 años, en la actualidad se desempeña como asistente en la facultad de administración en una universidad, con su salario cubre con sus gastos de estudios ya que su profesión es algo que a él le gusta mucho y es muy importante  culminarlos para poder aspirar a un mejor puesto laboral, por esta razón José solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera, ya que con su sueldo no le da para cubrir este gasto de una sola vez.
texts.en: José Manuel is 29 years old and is studying for a degree in public accounting and finance. He started working at age 12. He is currently working as an assistant in the administration department in a university. With his salary, he pays the costs of his studies since his profession is something that he likes a lot, and it is very important to finish his studies to be able to aspire to a better job. This is why José is requesting the support of a loan to be able to pay for a course towards his degree, since his salary is not enough to cover this expense in one lump sum.

loans.use: to pay for a course towards his degree.

loans.name: Iraida Isayana

texts.es: La joven Iraida tiene 24 años, desde los 21 trabaja como asistente administrativa en un restaurante, ella estudia la carrera de licenciatura en administración turística y hotelera, los gastos de estudio los cubre gracias al apoyo familiar, Iraida solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación ya que le interesa mucho su profesión porque hoy en día el turismo en nuestro país está tomando un gran auge y su mayor sueño es ser una profesional para seguir creciendo y ser parte del desarrollo de Nicaragua y ayudar a su mama quien la ha apoyado con tanto sacrificio.
texts.en:
Iraida is a 24 year old young woman.  She has worked as an administrative assistant at a restaurant since she was 21.  She is studying for a degree in  tourism.  Her educational expenses are covered thanks to the support of her family.

Iraida is requesting the support of a loan to be able to pay for the for licensing and registration requirements.  She is so interested in her profession because these days tourism in our country is really booming.  Her biggest dream is to be a professional in order to continue growing and being part of Nicaragua’s development.  She also wants to help her mother, who has supported her with so much sacrifice.

loans.use: to pay for the for licensing and registration requirements.

loans.name: Luis Leonidas

texts.es: Don Leónidas tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, ellos residen en la comunidad de Miraflores, Patuca, Olancho. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también le ayuda a su esposo en la finca de café, don Leónidas vivía en la zona del Paraíso solo venia por la temporada a cortar café y poco a poco se fue familiarizando y le fue gustando todo lo que tenia que ver con la caficultura ya que desde hace 10 años empezó cultivando su finca y hoy en día tiene a su familia reunida y tiene su propio cafetal, ya que junto con sus hijos y su esposa sacan la cosecha y cortan el café. El horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a  2:00 de la tarde. La ventaja que tiene don Leónidas es que el café esta a buen precio y tiene mucha demanda. El préstamo que don Leónidas esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra. El único desafío que se le presentan son las diferentes plagas que dañan el café por lo que tiene que controlarlas.  Su meta es que sus hijos puedan estudiar y que se hagan profesionales, también poder tener una finca más grande. Es el segundo financiamiento que don Leónidas solicita en FAMA y hasta el momento ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Leónidas is 48 years old, married and has three children. They live in the community of Miraflores, Patuca, Olancho. His wife takes care of the domestic chores and also helps her husband on the coffee farm. Leónidas lived in the Paraíso area and would only come for the season to cut coffee and, little by little, he became familiar with it and to like everything that had to do with coffee growing. For more than 10 years now he has been cultivating his farm and today has his family reunited and has his own coffee plantation. Together with his children and his wife, they harvest and cut the coffee. The working hours are from 6am to 2pm. The advantage that Leónidas has is that the coffee is at a good price and has a high demand. Leónidas needs the loan that he is requesting to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and to hire labor. The only challenge that he faces are the different pests that harm the coffee, so he has to control them. His goal is for his children to be able to study and become professionals, and also to be able to have a bigger farm. This is the second financing that Leónidas has requested from FAMA and so far he has made his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hire labor.

loans.name: Rebeca Fabiola

texts.es:
Rebeca, una joven de 27 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Managua, soltera, estudiante universitaria, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería la cual tiene 2 años de estar funcionando. Inicio vendiendo leche agria y helados, con el tiempo sus vecinos le preguntaban  si vendía otros productos comestibles además que lo proveedores le ofrecían vender gaseosas, snacks y jugos. Además que en donde vive esta cerca una escuela primaria esto la motivo aún más poner una pulpería poco a poco le fue agregando productos comestibles así como artículos escolares. Ella comparte sus actividades en el negocio con su mama y una hermana. 
Esta solicitando el crédito para comprar granos básicos, productos lácteos, artículos de limpieza, artículos escolares, cosméticos. Esta inversión le permitirá surtir de más productos su negocio lo cual resulta muy atractivo para sus clientes. Uno de sus proyectos es agregar  la venta de productos literarios como diccionarios, libros de historia, enciclopedias.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 27, is a native of the city of Managua.  She is a single university student, and she is also the owner of a small grocery store that has been in business for 2 years.  She started out selling fermented milk and ice cream.  Over time, her neighbors were asking her if she could sell other food products, so she also started to sell soft drinks, snacks and juices.  Because she lives close to an elementary school, she decided to expand her store gradually by adding school supplies and additional food items.  Rebeca shares her activities in the business with her mother and a sister.

Rebeca is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, dairy products, cleaning products, school supplies and cosmetics.  This investment will allow her to stock up her business with more products so that it is more appealing to her customers.  One of her plans is to start selling books such as dictionaries, history books and encyclopedias.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, cleaning products, school supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa, 39 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, casada, madre de tres hijos de los cuales son el menor de 15 años está a su cargo los otros dos viven independiente. Empezó con su negocio con ayuda de su esposo quien le dio capital para que iniciara su propio negocio y ella decidió instalar una mini pulpería. Actualmente tiene 2 años con su pulpería, la cual le ha permitido a ella independencia económica, aportar con los gastos del hogar y apoyar a su hijo menor en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja reparando radiadores con lo que gana ayuda a solventar los gastos familiares. 
Ella está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar un frízer usado, granos básicos, aceite, productos de limpieza, jugos , gaseosas. Pues la temporada navideña es una de las mejores para el sector comercio y no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender. Uno de sus proyectos es agregar la venta de ropa y carnes para ir poco a poco diversificando su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, is a retail merchant.  She is married and is the mother of 3 children.  Two of her children are living independently, and the youngest, who is 15, is still in her care.  Rosa started her business with the help of her husband, who gave her the start-up capital.  She decided to start a small grocery store.  

At this time, she's had 2 years of experience with her store.  It has allowed her to have financial independence, contribute to the household expenses, and support her youngest child in school.  Her husband works repairing radiators, and with his earnings he helps to pay the family's expenses.

Rosa needs a loan to buy a used freezer, basic grains, cooking oil, cleaning products, juices, and soft drinks.  As the Christmas season is one of the best times for business, she doesn't want to miss out on the opportunity to make sales.  One of her plans is to expand her business by selling clothing and meat.  This way, she could gradually diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy a used freezer, basic grains, cooking oil, cleaning products, juices, and soft drinks

loans.name: Maribell

texts.es:
Maribel, de 43 años, de oficio comerciante, casada, habitante de la ciudad de Managua. Su negocio lo empezó vendiendo perfumes y telas. Cuando regreso a su pueblo de donde es originaria compro una vaca la cual después vendió y con el dinero obtenido logro poner su pulpería la cual solo vendía granos básicos con el tiempo le fue agregando nuevos, además se siente que su negocio beneficia a su clientela quienes a diario la visitan en busca de los necesario para el hogar. 
Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, enlatados, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, productos lácteos, adornos navideños. La temporada de las ventas fuertes está cerca y quiere estar preparada para atender a sus clientas. Su meta próxima es agregarle nueva mercadería a su pulpería y pagar el crédito para sacar otro y comprar estantes, vitrinas para exhibir productos.
texts.en:
Maribel, 43, works as a saleswoman. She is married and lives in Managua. Maribel started her business selling perfumes and fabrics. When she returned to the town where she was born, she bought a cow and then sold it. With the money she made, she opened a corner store where she sold basic grains, but with time she started adding more things. She feels that her store is good for her customers, who regularly visit it looking for home supplies.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, canned food, oil, juices, sodas, dairy products and Christmas decorations. The upcoming season is good for selling and she wants to be prepared to serve her customers. Her short term goal is to add more merchandise to her store and pay back the loan. Then, she will request a new one and she will buy shelves and showcases to display her products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, canned food, oil, juices, sodas, dairy products and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is a married businessman who carries out transport of goods and people, with a motorcycle. He has been in this trade for two years. He earns additional income by selling fire wood.

He learned of Milango from a friend and joined in order to access capital. He is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to buy fire wood and service the motorcycle. The only challenges in the business are the high cost of spare parts and fluctuating fuel prices. Raymond is determined to carry out his operations well despite the challenges, because he believes that it is from such a venture that he can establish his family. His future ambition is to be able to purchase many motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy fire wood and service the motorcycle.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been running a shop and a cafe for the past 11 years. Both businesses give him a combined income of KES 80,000 per month.

 
He has a good credit history and is now servicing his third loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase maize flour, sugar, soap and other stock to boost his shop.


He intends to use his anticipated profits to support his family and boost his cafeteria business. He is hopeful that his business will expand to other regions.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar, soap and other stock to boost his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a welding machine and spare parts to stock in the workshop.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Frutos del Progreso” perteneciente a la comuna de la florida, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de comida rápida, desde hace 6 años. Se desempeña en sus labores de lunes a domingo desde las 9ºº hasta las 18ºº horas y los fines de semana trabaja hasta las 02ºº de la mañana, tiene una persona que le ayuda en las ventas y preparación de sus productos, se desplaza con su carro a varias partes para aumentar sus ventas.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en supermercados, ferias, carnicerías y distribuidoras de bebida encontrando todo a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará otro carro para instalarlo en un terreno que ella tiene.
Una de las metas de Georgina es agregar otro tipo de productos a la venta como mote con huesillo, croquetas, hamburguesas que su misma clientela le ha ido solicitando, además instalarse en su terreno para poder colocar sus maquinas y agrandar su negocio, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y una  mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
Georgina vive junto a su esposo, un hijo que se encuenta delicado de salud, una hija y su nieta. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es instalar un negocio estable en su terreno para no andar de un lado a otro y a la vez tener mas clientela, ya que tendría un negocio bastante cómodo y agradable para recibir a su clientela.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
La Florida es una comuna ubicada al suroriente de Santiago, capital de Chile, región Metropolitana. Su población actual es muy diversa, representando a todos los sectores socioeconómicos (alto, medio alto, medio y medio bajo). La zona cuenta con una activa vida comercial, la que se manifiesta en la existencia de varios nuevos centros comerciales. Es un sector que ha tenido un explosivo crecimiento demográfico en los últimos años.
texts.en:
Georgina is a part of the “Frutos del Progreso” communal bank, located in the Florida community, of the City of Santiago.

She has been selling fast food for six years and works Monday thru Friday from 9:00a to 6:00p and ‘til 2:00a on the weekends.  She has someone to help her with sales and preparation and she travels around to different locations by car in order to increase her sales.

She buys her supplies and merchandise at supermarkets, fairs, and soft drink distributers at low cost for the most part.

She will use the money from this loan to buy another car that she will keep on her land.

One of Georgina’s goals is to add another items that her customers have requested, such as “mote con huesillo” (a traditional Chilean summer-time non-alcoholic drink made from wheat and peaches), crockets, and hamburgers.  She would also like to set up on her land so that she can set up her equipment and expand her business.  In this way she can increase her income and improve her family’s quality of life.

Georgina lives with her husband, her son who is of fragile health, her daughter, and a niece.  Her dreams are to create a stable business so that she doesn’t have to move around and so that she can increase her number of customers and serve them comfortably.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity she has gotten through Fondo Esperanza because it’s allowed her to invest in her business.

She also feels very comfortable with the companionship from the rest of the communal bank’s members, who have diverse interests and activities.  The training she has had at the various meetings has also helped her to better manage her business.



The Florida community is located southeast of metropolitan area of Santiago, the capital of Chile.  Its population is very diverse, representing all socio-economic sectors (high, upper middle, middle, and lower middle).  The zone has an active business life and manifests itself in the form of many business centers.  This sector has experienced an explosive demographic growth in recent years.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nasipa

texts.ru: Насипа 60 лет, вдова.Насипа начала заниматься животноводством и растениеводством, ставшим основным источником финансирования ее семьи. Насипа начала свой бизнес со стартовой суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS) в 2006 году, и смогла развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее 1 корову с теленком и 10 баранов, с ежемесячной прибылью в 3,000 сом (KGS). На своей земле Насипа выращивает сено и ячмень. Скот она откармливает и продает на местном скотском рынке. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насипа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Насипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем -отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Nasipa is 60 years old and a widow. She has begun working in animal husbandry and raising crops, and this has become the main source of income for her family. In 2006, she began her business with a start-up sum of only 3,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS.) She has managed to develop her farm, which now includes 1 cow and calf and 10 sheep, bringing in monthly earnings of 3,000 KGS. On her land, Nasipa grows barley and straw. She fattens cows and sells them at the local cattle market. For the purpose of further developing her business, Nasipa has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 Som (KGS) to buy more cattle. She plans to use the extra income generated by this loan to re-invest in her business and, in the future, to renovate her home.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Шамигул проживает в районе Хуросон. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Шамигул портниха. Она вместе с дочерью занимается шитьем национальных платьев. В этой области Шамигул уже десять лет. Она берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en: Shamigul lives in the Khuroson region. She is 43 years old, married, and has 6 children. She is a seamstress, and she and her daughter work together sewing national dresses. Shamigul has been doing this for 10 years. She is now seeking a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Takku Ligguey Sam N 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Takku Ligguey SAM 6" se compose de 5 femmes.Une seule de ces femmes est célibataire.Les quatre autres sont mariées et mères de famille.Elles vendent des tissus et des produits cosmétiques. Elles s'approvisionnent en Gambie et revendent leurs produits à crédit.Ce commerce leur permet de subvenir aux dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles et à leurs propres besoins.Le chef de groupe ( main levée, au milieu), est mère de deux enfants.Elle vend des produits cosmétiques,des chaussures de femmes et d'enfants. Elle participe fortement aux dépenses d'alimentation et de santé de la famille.Le groupe sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et des tissus.
texts.en: The "Takku Ligguey SAM 6" group is made up of five women. Only one of the women is single. The four others are married mothers. They sell fabric and cosmetics. They stock up in Gambia and resell their products on credit. This business allows them to provide for their families' spending and their own needs. The group leader (with her hand raised, in the center) is the mother of two children. She sells cosmetics, and women's and children's shoes. She participates strongly as a provider for her children's food expenses and the family's health expenses. The group is asking for a loan of 500,000 XOF.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and fabric.

loans.name: Lkhagvatseren

texts.en:
Lkhagvatseren is 36 years old, lives with his wife and a 13-year-old son in their house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital. Their house is located in the area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Lkhagvatseren has been running a transportation business with his wife since 2000. He rides a micro-bus with 14 seats and runs through the east and west sides of the city. His wife works as a conductor and gathers the money from passengers for the transportation. Lkhagvatseren loves his micro-bus because it provides money to his family. 

So before the winter Lkhagvatseren is planning to build a garage near his house to prevent the car from freezing up. If his car breaks down he would need more days to fix the car and to spend additional expenses.

loans.use: to build a garage near his house to prevent the car from freezing up.

loans.name: Tuvshinbold

texts.en:
Tuvshinbold is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 4-year-old daughter in their house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital. 

During the last two years Tuvshinbold has been doing a plumbing job on call and running a taxi business. His wife has been working as a planning officer in a cashmere factory. Last winter, Tuvshinbold insulated the walls of his house by taking a loan. He repaid the loan in October. Tuvshinbold thanks Kiva lenders, for his family has improved their living conditions and are ready to face the winter.

This time Tuvshinbold is requesting a loan to build a garage. By building a garage Tuvshinbold can prevent his car from breaking down due to the cold.

loans.use: to build a garage in order to prevent his car from breaking down.

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Bolor-Erdene is 19 years old and lives with her husband in their ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar. She runs a taxi business and her husband works as a plasterer. They built the ger nearby the parents' house, on the plot of land of her parents-in-law. Both sets of parents bought a ger as a gift for their wedding. 

In the future, Bolor-Erdene wants to have her own land and house, and to educate herself at university. She tried to get into university this year but she was late for admissions.

As a young married couple, Bolor-Erdene and her husband want to buy furniture to furnish their ger in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture to furnish her ger.

loans.name: Magraj

texts.en:
Magraj is 47 years old and the head of the family. She lives with her son in the Bayan-Ulgii province. Her son Erkinbek is 22 years old and works in a rivate company.

She has been operating a toy store since 1994. In the past few months she was sick and her business stopped temporarily, but now she is restarting her store again and importing toys from Taikeshken. 

She is requesting a loan of 3.500.000 MNT to import toys for her toy store and restart her business. She is hard-working and a kind person.

loans.use: to restart her business by importing toys.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren keeps doing his business and his business is going quite well. He has fully repaid his previous loan in October as scheduled. During this period he never missed a due date. 

Ever since Davaasuren has been cooperating with Kiva, some changes have occurred in his life and business. Now Davaasuren sells his souvenirs in Inner Mongolia of China and has met a regular purchaser. Every two months he goes to China to sell his souvenirs and if he has a great amount of orders he hires 2 or 3 people to help him. 

He is sure that if he hadn't been introduced to Kiva he would be living as before. Davaasuren expressed his deep gratitude to Kiva lenders for helping people, including himself. With their support, Davaasuren has had a chance to change his life. Therefore, his business goes well.

Davaasuren is planning to build a house next spring. This time Davaasuren is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy materials which will be used to build the house, as their price is low right now.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a house.

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.ru:
Очень талантливый и целеустремленный молодой человек, которого зовут Акмалчон, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как его родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу. Акмалчону 19 лет. Он студент 2 курса Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он отлично окончил школу, и данное время является одним из успешных студентов. Его однокурсники и преподаватели уважают его за то, что у него есть все черты хорошего человека: толерантность, интеллигентность и мотивация. Не давно, у него была семестровая работа, и он сдал отлично и хорошо. Этот талантливый студент учится на договорной основе и должен оплатить за учебный договор каждый год. Акмалчон трудно справляется с расходами студенческой жизни, так как у него самого нет источника дохода, а его родители работают в государственных учреждениях и получают маленькую зарплату. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. 
Этот займ поможет ему оплатить за учебный договор и таким образом окончить 2 курс и приближаться в цели. Он надеется только на вас и обещает погашать займ во время, так как его родители помогут ему в этом.
texts.en:
A very talented and goal-oriented young man named Akmaljon needs your help, since his parents aren't in a position to pay his tuition.  Akmaljon is 19 years old and a second year student at the Tajik Technical University.  He graduated from high school with excellent grades and presently, he is one of the best students at the university.  His classmates and teachers respect him for having all the traits of a good person:  tolerance, intellectuality, and motivation.  He recently had an end-of-semester assignment, for which he got good and excellent marks.

This talented student isn't subsidized by the government and must pay his tuition every year.  It's difficult for Akmaljon to deal with the expenses of student life as he himself has no source of income and his parents work in government bureaus where they receive small salaries.  He is requesting a loan for $1000 for the payment of his university tuition.  This loan will help him by paying his tuition to finish his second year and move closer to his goals.  He is relying only on you and he promises to repay the loan on time as his parents will help him with this.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Monhjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Monhjargal is 42 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ger in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband Tushig is in South Korea working as a contract worker. Her son Temuujin, 21, is a university student, and her son Tsolmon, 15, is a secondary school student. She has been working as a saleswoman since 2001 in the local market. She also works part-time at home as a tailor. She is now planning to start her own business of clothing retail at a rental counter of the local market. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase clothes to start her business of clothing retail at a rental counter at the local market. She is a hardworking and friendly person.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to start her business of clothing retail at a rental counter of the local market

loans.name: Monhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Monhtsetseg is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their house in the Han-Uul District of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Batsaihan, 37, works as a security guard for a private company. Her daughter Hulan, 15, is a secondary school student. Her son Bat-Irmuun, 2, stays at home. She has been working as a hairdresser for 3 years, and she is now planning to start her own business of a barber shop in a spare room in their house. She is now asking for a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase hairdresser equipment, tools and other necessary stuff for her business. She is a hardworking and open-minded person.

loans.use: to purchase hairdresser equipment, tools and other necessary stuff for her business

loans.name: Mereke

texts.en:
Mr.Mereke, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in their house in Bayan-Ulgii province in Mongolia. His wife Gulsheker works part-time at a local school, while his son Ahjol is a primary school student and his daughter Ahbota goes to kindergarten.

A hardworking, diligent and honest person, Mereke has been providing a taxi service for four years now. His car has broken down and he is now requesting a loan of 1'500'000MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas car to run his taxi service business.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas car to run his taxi service business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock and refurbishing materials.

loans.name: Edward

texts.es:
Edward de 44 años, es un hombre emprendedor y soñador. Vive en su propia casa junto a su conviviente María quien es su socia en la actividad de ventas de bebidas gasificadas. Tienen 2 hijas, quienes estudian  en el colegio.
El trabajo de Edward consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas tales como cervezas de  distintas marcas y  gaseosas  de sabores variables, cuenta con una congeladora lo que le permite tener las bebidas siempre heladas al gusto del cliente. Este trabajo lo realiza en un local que esta en el interior de su propia casa. Lleva 6 años en este negocio y le esta yendo bien. pues comenta que se inicio en este negocio porque en el lugar donde vive no había tienda donde comprar estas bebidas. Considera rentable su actividad económica por el intenso calor que hay en la ciudad, por ello la gente consume más bebidas, entonces sus ventas se incrementan y obtiene ganancias favorables. Comenta que  los problemas que tenía al principio eran por no poder  adquirir las bebidas demandadas por los clientes por falta de capital de respaldo. Espera surgir y contar con el capital para reconstruir su local para dar mejor atención a la gente que acude a su negocio. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, está contento de ser socio del grupo del cual es parte, porque los demás socios son puntuales y responsables. Esta agradecido con la institución ya que le da la oportunidad de tener un capital de respaldo. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles  comprará un equipo de sonido, mesas, sillas, etc. Para mejorar la  atención e incrementar su clientela. Entonces  incrementara sus ganancias  y pagara sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Edward, 44 years old, is an entrepreneur and a dreamer. He lives in his own home with his partner María, who helps him in the activity of selling carbonated beverages. They have two children who are studying in school.

Edward’s work consists of selling carbonated beverages such as different brands of beer, and soft drinks of various flavors. He has a freezer which permits him to have iced cold drinks to please his customers. This work is done in a facility that is at his own house. He has been in this business for six years and it’s going well. He says that he began this business because the place where he lives did not have a store where you could buy these drinks. He considers it a profitable business because of the intense heat of the city, causing people to drink more beverages, then his sales increase and he gets better profits. 

He says that the problems that he had at first were because he could not buy the drinks his customers wanted due to the lack of capital backing. He is waiting to raise capital in order to rebuild his facility to give better service to the people that come to his business. So this will be his fourth loan through the institution MFP. He is happy being a member of the group of which he is a part, because the other members are punctual and responsible.

He is grateful to the institution because it offers the opportunity of having capital backing. With the requested amount of 2000 soles he will buy a sound system, tables and chairs, etc., in order to improve the service and increase his customer base. Then his earnings will increase and he will make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a sound system, and tables and chairs to give atmosphere to his business

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es: Isaela de 63 años, es una mujer innovadora, esforzada y soñadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a Edmundo su conviviente que a la vez es su socio en el trabajo que realiza, que es la  siembra de plantas cítricas; como son limones, mandarinas, naranjas; asimimo se dedica en la crianza de ganado vacuno como actividad secundaria. Realiza su labor en su Finca que esta a un kilómetro de su vivienda. Lleva 20 años en el cultivo de cítricos, pues anteriormente no tenia los medios para sustentar su familia, es así que deciden dedicarse a esta actividad. Ahora junto a su conviviente y 2 obreros que contrata, se dedican al riego, fertilización y cuidado de los cultivos. Cuando cosechan transportan los productos a los diferentes mercados de la ciudad para venderlos al por mayor. Considera rentable su negocio, pues los precios de los productos cítricos esta en aumento de precio. Al comenzar a trabajar en este rubro no tenía el conocimiento suficiente sobre productos cítricos y  no contaba con el capital suficiente, así que decidido informarse, capacitarse  y decidió junto a su conviviente hacer  un préstamo para iniciar  su labor económica. Espera seguir manteniendo su negocio que va creciendo cada día más. Por tanto será su préstamo número 20  con la institución MFP, esta muy agradecida con la institución porque con el préstamo le ayudan  acrecentar su capital. Se lleva muy bien con la gente del grupo de la cual es socia, por que todos tienen las ganas de seguir creciendo y  ser puntuales en sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado  4000 soles, lo utilizará en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, para obtener una buena producción y también pagara a los obreros que la ayudan en la siembra y cosecha de su producto.
texts.en: Isabela is 63 years old. She is an innovative and hard-working woman and a dreamer. She lives in her own house together with Edmundo, her live-in partner who is also her partner in the work she does: growing citrus fruits such as limes, mandarines and oranges. She also works raising cattle as a secondary activity. She carries out her work on her farm, which is one kilometer from her home. She has been growing citrus fruits for 20 years, since previously she did not have the means to support her family. Because of this, they decided to dedicate themselves to this activity. Now together with her partner and 2 contracted workers, they water, fertilize and cultivate the crops. When they harvest the fruits, they transport them to the various markets of the city and sell them on a wholesale basis. She considers her business profitable, since the prices for citrus fruits are rising. When she began working in this area, she did not have sufficient knowledge about citrus fruits and did not have enough capital. Thus, she decided to become informed and get training, and she decided together with her partner to take out a loan to start her economic activity. She hopes to continue to maintain her business, which keeps growing day by day. Thus, this will be loan number 20 for her with the MFP institution, and she is very grateful to the institution because the loan will help her increase her capital. She gets along very well with the people in the group where she is a member, because all of them have the desire to keep growing and to be punctual with their payments. With the amount she is requesting, 4000 soles, she will buy fertilizers and compost to obtain good production, and she will also pay the laborers who help her grow and harvest her products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana de 42 años, es una mujer amable y  alegre; esta casada con Rubén, quien trabaja en la municipalidad de la ciudad. Vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijas, quienes estudian en la universidad. El trabajo de Eliana consiste en la venta de abarrotes  como arroz, aceite, harina, sal, leche, huevos, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas  entre otros, esta actividad la realiza en un local en el interior de su casa propia.  Se inicio en esta actividad por sus hijos a quienes ama, y lograr darles una  mejor calidad de vida, solventar sus estudios e ingresen a la universidad. Su esposo la ayuda en sus compras en las distintas distribuidoras donde venden al por mayor, para que obtengan un incremento en sus ganancias. Lleva 4 años en esta actividad y le esta yendo muy bien. Espera agrandar el local donde esta, quiere surgir  e incrementar sus ganancias. Por tanto éste será su prestamo número 3 con la institución  MFP,  esta muy contenta con su grupo por que la tratan amablemente, esto la motiva a seguir pagando sus cuotas a tiempo. Tiene tranquilidad ya que cuenta con un capital de respaldo, con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, lo utilizará para comprar y abastecerse de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, harina, sal, leche, huevos, etc. Para que sus clientes sigan permaneciendo y sena fieles a su negocio.
texts.en:
Eliana, who is 42 years old, is a pleasant and cheerful woman. She is married to Rubén, who is a municipal employee in the city where they live. She lives in her own house together with her 3 daughters, who are studying at university. 

Eliana sells groceries, such as rice, oil, flour, salt, milk, eggs, sweets and carbonated soft drinks, etc. She carries out this activity from a premises that is part of her own home. She started this business because of her children, whom she loves, in order to give them a better quality of life. She also hoped it would pay for their studies and that they would go to university. Her husband helps her with the purchases she makes from the different wholesale distributors. She buys goods wholesale to increase her earnings. 

She has run this business for 4 years and it is going very well. She hopes to expand her premises. She also wants to increase her profits. For this reason she is requesting the loan, which is her third from MFP.  She is very happy with her group because they treat her kindly. This motivates her to continue making her payments on time. Also she finds it reassuring that there is backup capital. She will use the 1500 soles to buy and sell basic necessities, such as rice, oil, flour, salt, milk and eggs, etc.  In this way she hopes that her customers will continue to buy from her and be loyal to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, flour, salt, milk and eggs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia de 65 años, es una mujer fuerte y amable. Es divorciada. Vive en su casa propia junto con sus 2 hijas de 20 y 22 años quienes la acompañan y la ayudan en su negocio familiar.
El trabajo de Lucia consiste  en brindar un tiempo de distracción y diversión a sus clientes, su centro de entretenimiento esta ubicado al costado de su vivienda.  Cuenta con una piscina y diferentes ambientes como un lugar de venta de bebidas gasificadas, comidas, entre otras.  Comenta que se inicio en este negocio  porque sus amigos buscaban un lugar  donde relajarse, distraerse  y no había  un ambiente adecuado, fue entonces que decidió aperturar dicho negocio. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas quienes le ayudan en la atención de las personas que recurren a este lugar cada fin de semana. También la ayudan en la venta de entradas para bañarse en la piscina y en la preparación de  distintos platos de comida.  Considera rentable su negocio porque las personas cada fin de semana buscan un ambiente acogedor  donde puedan pasarla en familia  y considera que su recreo es el indicado. Quiere seguir manteniendo su negocio y seguir creciendo como empresaria. Por tanto éste será su préstamo numero 2  con la institución MFP, esta  muy emocionada porque en su grupo la acogieron con amabilidad. Espera seguir siendo socia de este grupo. 
Con el monto solicitado  1000  soles, lo utilizará para comprar un refrigerador de 900 soles y también comprará  víveres para preparar  las distintas viandas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia, 65, is a kind and strong woman. She is divorced and lives in her own home with her two daughters ages 20 and 22 who help her with the family business. Lucia’s work is to provide a time of distraction and entertainment to customers. Her entertainment center is located on the side of her house. It features a swimming pool and different environments such as a place to sell soft drinks, food, among others. She says she started this business because her friends were looking for a place to unwind and relax and there wasn’t a suitable place. It was then she decided to open this business. She relies on her daughters’ help who help in the care of people who use this place every weekend. Also they help in selling tickets to swim in the pool and in the preparation of various dishes. She considers her business profitable because every weekend people look for a place to have fun with their family and she considers her place to be suitable. She wants to continue with her business and continue to grow as an entrepreneur. 

This will be her second loan with MFP institution. She is very excited because her group has welcomed her with kindness. She hopes to continue to be a member of this group. With the requested amount of 1000 Peruvian soles she will buy a refrigerator for 900 Peruvian soles and buy supplies to prepare various meat in her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and products to prepare food.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nonito

texts.en:
Nonito is a 56-year-old resident of Lower Usogan, Bonifacio, in the Philippines. For 33 years, Nonito has helped to support his family, using the small amount of money he generates (6,000 PHP monthly) from his corn and coconut production business. 

This year, as a member of GDMPC, Nonito is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops for his business. One day, Nonito hopes to expand his corn and coconut production business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to support his corn and coconut production business.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 27 years old, married, and has one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Chona has been raising pigs for two years, and she earns additional income from selling medicine.

Chona is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lamdaria

texts.en:
Lamdaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,500 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell for her buy and sell banana business.

Lamdaria has been in this business for nine years. Lamdaria earns more income from growing bananas.

Lamdaria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old and married with nine children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items to sell like canned goods, spices, bread, soft drinks, etc..

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns additional income from rice and vegetables vending.

Letecia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to finish sending two of her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, spices, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Trivinia

texts.en:
Trivinia is 65 years old and lives in Sinian, Baliangao. She is single with no children. 

Trivinia has a shop selling grocery items and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to purchase 8 cases of soft drinks and 10 boxes of grocery items.

Trivinia has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and boxes of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing boat.

Marilyn has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing boat

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
Saturnino is 48 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child.
 
Saturnino is engaged in the fruit and vegetable production and selling business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to be used in building a fruit and vegetable stand for his existing business.
 
Saturnino became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Saturnino hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To build a fruit and vegetable stand

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Merlina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice and from farming vegetables. Merlina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF, to purchase additional bananas to resell.

Merlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has two children. She is 59 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City.

To earn a living, Elizabeth has a snack vending business. She has had this business for almost two years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 1,500. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

Elizabeth hopes to improve her life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Mrs Purevsuren is 54 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, in their small wooden house in Kherlen, the third largest city in Mongolia. She has a job, working as a cleaner in a local company. Her husband doesn’t have a job. Her daughter is 18 years old and attends University. Her son is living in the countryside, and every month he sends some money home for his family. Purevsuren’s family has a low income, but they live a life full of happiness. 

Purevsuren is planning to reconstruct her house, and to thicken the walls with materials that keep the heat in as long as possible. She will use brick to thicken the house walls on the outside, and basalt wool (rockwool insulation) on the inside. By doing this, she can cut the usage of charcoal by several times, in comparison with the house as it currently stands. Purevsuren will use the loan to repair her house and to thicken and insulate its walls.

loans.use: to repair her house, and to thicken and insulate its walls

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila Esperanza de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su familia; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este rubro por eso se ha hecho de gran experiencia, eso le ayuda a obtener muy buenas cosechas, comercia en todos los alrededores de la zona y ya tiene mucha clientela pues saben  que todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y aprecios accesibles además el servicio es excelente, para complementar los gastos del hogar también vende tortillas pues es muy rentable y ella se provee el maiz; Zoila es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante sabe que solo con esfuerzo y dedicación lograra un futuro mejor, en la última cosecha tuvo  grandes pérdidas, en esta temporada de siembra quiere recuperarse invirtiendo en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, leña etc. Zoila Esperanza tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable y está segura que saldara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Zoila Esperanza is 45 years old and lives with her family.  She farms, has been raising corn for several years, and has gained lots of experience.  This has helped her obtain good harvests which she sells all around the zone and has many customers.  They know that everything she sells is of good quality, at good prices, and with excellent service.  She also sells tortillas and it’s very profitable.  Zoila is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead and knows that she will create a better future with dedication and effort.  She had some losses in her latest harvest and she wants to recover during this planting season by investing in supplies, so she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL.  This will allow her to buy corn seed, fertilizer, insecticide, firewood, etc.  Zoila Esperanza has a good payment record, is very responsible, and is sure that she will get out of debt and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es: Rosa Esperanza de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida; ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde, tiene varios años de dedicarse al rubro y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa en el negocio,  es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque todo lo que comercia es de calidad, lo vende a un buen  precio y el servicio es excelente, Rosa Esperanza es una mujer ejemplar, entregada a su trabajo siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan salir adelante pues sabe que así podrá alcanzar el éxito, En esta última temporada tuvo algunas perdidas y tiene el deseo de recuperarse pero necesita invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita ganado. Rosa Esperanza tiene buenas referencias crediticias y tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Esperanza, 29, lives with her life partner.  She makes a living raising livestock.  She has done this work for several years and has a lot of valuable experience in the business.  She's well known in the area and has acquired a lot of customers because everything she sells is of high quality and reasonably priced, and her service is excellent.

Rosa Esperanza is an exemplary woman who is devoted to her job.  She's always waiting for new opportunities that will allow her to get ahead, because she knows that this way she'll be successful.

This past season she had some losses and she wants to recover from them.  She needs to invest in supplies, though, so she's asking Integral for a loan to buy livestock.

Rosa Esperanza has good credit references and is certain that she'll be able to repay the debt.  She also trusts that she'll give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 43 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.

To earn a living, Marilyn has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Marilyn has requested a loan to purchase foods for snacks to sell/retail.

Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Marilyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for snacks to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a rice mill business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to pay for the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

Letecia has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with three children. Virginia has been earning a living by running a business where she sells ready-to-wear ( RTW) clothing and she has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 9,000 PHP from this type of work. 

Virginia has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase more RTW clothing. She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Virginia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married and has one child. She is 56 years old and lives in the municipality of Titay in Zamboanga Sibugay Province.

Marilou sells sari-sari products to earn a living and had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 4,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional capital.

Marilou has been a member of PMPC during this year. In the future, Marilou hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her sari sari store

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is married with two children. Benjamin is 53 years old and lives in the village of Baybay in the municipality of Liloy in Zamboanga del Norte Province.

Benjamin sells merchandise to earn a living and had this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns 30,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP for additional capital.

Benjamin has been a member of PMPC for this year. In the future, Benjamin hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap

loans.name: Abdurrahman

texts.en:
Abdurrahman, 32, work as a fisherman. His wife works as a teacher in an elementary school. He has two toddlers. 

As a fisherman, Abdurrahman goes to sea to catch fish and sells them to the big buyer. He has a speciality in selling fish: He only sells ornamental fish and lobster.
 
Abdurrahman wants to increase his business. He wants to directly sell the fish and lobster to the city to get a higher price. He needs a loan to make it. He borrowed 5,000,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) to purchase more ornamental fish and lobsters. Besides purchasing ornamental fish and lobsters, the loan will also be used to fix his boat. 

He hopes his plan to sell directly to the city to get a higher price will work and he can earn a satisfactory profit. Abdurrahman has a dream to buy a car when he has enough money to make it easier to distribute the fish and lobsters to the city.

loans.use: to purchase more ornamental fish and lobsters.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a 61-year-old resident of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Nenita provides for her family from the little amount of 4,000 she gains monthly from her gardening business of three years. Since 2006 she has been a member of GDMPC. She will use the loan of 7,500 from GDMPC to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Nenita wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
Nerlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business. Nerlita has been in this business for three years. She  earns more income from buy and sell charcoal.

Nerlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more stock of bananas to sell for her business.

Shirley has been in this business for one year. Shirley earns more income from buying and selling rice.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is married with seven children. Ramona is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion, Salug, Zamboanga del Norte.

Ramona owns an eatery/restaurant to earn a living and has had this business for 17 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her eatery business.

Ramona has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Ramona hopes to expand her eatery/restaurant business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her eatery business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
This is Nelia. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products like detergent soap, fabric softener, lotion, deodorant and other products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nelia hopes to be successful in her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items like ladies' shoes, shirts, toothpaste lotion, deodorant, perfume and other personal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
This is Adelfa, 45, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jeffrey and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Adelfa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12, 000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like ladies' shoes, shirts, lotion, deodorant, perfume and other personal products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Adelfa hopes to give her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like ladies' shoes, shirts, lotion, deodorant, perfume and other personal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo, aged 58, is a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo and is a mother to their children. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Consuelo operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, selling the items for a small profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other similar items. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options that she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 23,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear (RTW) products and items such as pants, shirts, dresses, undergarments, etc. to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Consuelo hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as pants, dresses, shirts, undergarments, etc. to sell in her business.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia  is a 30-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a small farm and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Malia has requested a loan to buy young piglets, barbed wire for the fence, pig food and a wheelbarrow.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Malia hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy young piglets, barbed wire, pig food and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Ma. Maylin

texts.en:
This is Ma. Maylin, 36, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin, a liaison officer, and she is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Maylin maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Maylin hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having their own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To  purchase supplies and merchandise like perfume, powder, soap, deodorant, shampoo, lotion and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is a 35-year-old married woman with five kids. She lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Rosie manages a gardening business to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She joined GDMPC in 2006. Rosie wishes that her business will increase.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ritche

texts.en:
Ritche is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental and is 36 years old. He is married and has 1 child. 

To make a living, Ritche owns and operates a business providing motor transport services. Ritche has been engaged in this business for 7 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2006, Ritche joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is single, 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. Paul is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for four years, and every month he earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from this work. 

He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Paul became a member of GDMPC this year. In the future, Paul hopes to gain double his income from his business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married with 3 children. She is 55 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City.
To earn a living, Marilou has a snack vending business. She has had this business for almost 1 years. Each day, she earns approximately PHP 200. Marilou has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and 6 months.
In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. She previously accessed a loan of 15,000 PHP that she used to buy spare parts, accessories, and to maintain her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion dreams of being able to give her children a high quality education through all her hard work. She hopes to have more tricycles. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her motorized tricycle.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 43 years old and lives in La Esperanza, Rizal. She is married with no children.
 
Emelita has a bread-making business and earns approximately 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients needed to make bread. 

Emelita has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of flour and other ingredients needed to make bread.

loans.name: Jenette

texts.en: Jenette is 33 years old and lives in Mitacas, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Jenette works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for a year. She has requested a loan to purchase five boxes of fish to sell. Jenette has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is 37 years old and lives in New Dapitan, Rizal. She is married with two children. Lorena has a retail business and earns approximately 6,200 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stock for her store. Lorena has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store.

location.town: Calamba-New Dapitan, Rizal, Zambo. Del Norte

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is married with four children. She is 59 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. Gloria sells grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 6,800 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 to purchase additional stocks. Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 36 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ana Marie is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Marie has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from tailoring and from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening, farming sugarcane and rice retailing. Wilma is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, soft drinks, etc., for her general store business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, soft drinks, etc., in her general store.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
This is Clarissa. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar, butter and other ingredients needed in her bakery. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar, butter and other ingredients needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Clarissa also has a variety store, and the loan will be of help to her store as well. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Clarissa dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients, such as flour, sugar, butter and other ingredients needed in her bakery.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is  a mother, married to Abner, a chopper. With her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Helen oversees the operations multicab transportation business. She owns one multicab (12-14 person capacity). A multicab is practical utility vehicle. It can also be used for product deliveries but now is mostly used for passenger transportation. The driver pays boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 per day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts, and to pay for maintenance work on her multicab unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Helen dreams to have a good life and hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members each week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of her multicab unit.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
This is Darwin, 40, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. His wife is Gemma, a housewife and a father to their children. He together with his wife manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Darwin operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Darwin hopes to give his children a good and quality education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is married with three children. She is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Adelaida buys and sells ready-to-wear dresses (RTWs) to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 9,000 for additional capital to buy more RTWs. Adelaida has been a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Adelaida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear dresses to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a general store business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc. Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a new member of PMPC under the microfinance program. She is 47 years old and married with three children, two adult-aged and one school-aged. She lives in Pasihagon, Siquijor, Siquijor. The major source of the family's income is fishing, which has primarily been operated by her husband for seven years and brings in an average monthly income of 2,000 PHP. Emma took a loan from PMPC in the amount of 3,000 to purchase fishing nets. She hopes to catch more fish by using her new fishing nets and improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Cristina has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell. Cristina has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Cristina would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with three children. Monica is 54 years old and lives in Villa C. Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Monica buys and sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP for additional capital to buy more sacks of charcoal.

Monica has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Monica hopes to expand her business.
