Ricardo is engaged in a lumber cutting and selling business and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to be used in paying for the logs and lumber, labor and other expenses in cutting lumber for his existing business. 

Ricardo became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Ricardo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To pay for logs and lumber, labor and other expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married and has three children. Maribel is 34 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Maribel sells dried fish to earn a living and had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 to buy more dried fish to sell.

Maribel has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Maribel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is married and has three children. Estela is 38 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Estela sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Estela has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Estela hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Santas works hard to support her family.

Santas requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for her business.

Santas has been in this business for 15 years now, and she also earns additional income by fattening pigs and running a general store.

In the future, Santas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married.  Marilou is 39 years old and lives in Villa C. Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Marilou sells cosmetic products to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year.  Each month, she earns PHP 1,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more cosmetics products.

Marilou has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Marilou hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics products

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is married with 1 child. Geraldine is 29 years old and lives in Farmington,Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Geraldine sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years.  She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for snacks.

Geraldine has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Geraldine hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for snacks

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is taking out a new loan to invest in his retail shop.  Thanks to the previous loan that enabled him to keep save some money which allowed him to open a small store. 

With this loan, he plans to buy stocks of wheat and maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.  He also testifies that the previous loan transformed his living standards to a more improved life.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat and maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is married with 1 child.  Jesus is 33 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Jesus is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living.  He has been doing this for 2 years.  He has requested for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizer.

Jesus has been a member of PMPC for this year.  In the future, Jesus hopes to expand his rice field

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes  is married with 2 children.  Lourdes  is 29 years old and lives in ZNAC,Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lourdes sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 5 months.  She has requested a loan of  PHP10,000 for additional capital.

Lourdes  has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Lourdes  hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: for additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, ceramic figurines and paintings.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
María Olga tiene 40 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija, vive con la madre y con la hija en Guaranda sector Cuatro esquinas Provincia de Bolívar.

LA VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central está formada por 12 socios que pertenecen al sector cuatro esquinas, los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como son agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y otros.

María Olga se dedica a al crianza de animales cómo pollos, cerdos y la agricultura  siembra papas, maíz.

Las compras y las ventas los realiza en Guaranda, Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, pollos, cerdos. Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudaría a tener otros ingresos. El sueño es poder incrementar el negocio.

Los desafíos a los que se presenta es la competencia. En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar y disfrutar de las festividades de la navidad.
texts.en:
María Olga is 40 years old, single and has one daughter. She lives with her mother and daughter in the town of Cuatro Esquinas, Guaranda, Bolivar Province. 

The Central Cuatro Esquinas Communal Bank is made up of 12 members who come from Cuatro Esquinas. The members are involved in various trades such as agriculture, raising animals, trade and others. 

María Olga raises animals such as chickens and pigs as well as agriculture as she sows potatoes and corn. 

She buys and sells in the city of Guaranda. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, chickens and pigs. This loan would help her bring in more income. Her dream is to be able to expand the business.

Her biggest challenge is competition. In her free time she likes to relax and enjoy Christmas festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, chickens and pigs

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 55 years old and lives in Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  She is married and has 3 children.

Jessie is engaged in services particularly in beauty parlor business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional accessories and for the improvement of her existing parlor business.

Jessie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Jessie hopes to engage in other type of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional accessories

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is 40 years old, married and a mother to seven children. 

She has been buying and selling livestock for several years, a business that supports her family with its basic everyday needs. 

Despite starting her business with just a few goats, she has slowly built it through hard work. Her sales continue to grow. 

She doesn't have enough money to expand, so she is applying for a loan to buy five goats and pay for labor cost to take them to the market. 

She dreams of having a large business that generates more income and a good life for herself and her family and provides for a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy five goats and pay for labor cost.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is married and has two children. Trinidad is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Trinidad is a farmer who grows hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. 

She has requested a loan of 2,000 PHP to purchase more feeds for her pigs.

Trinidad has been a member of PMPC during this year. In the future, Trinidad hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 52 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependent. 

Purita has a store where she sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing groceries and other consumable products for her business.

Purita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Purita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other consumable products to sell.

loans.name: Monhtuya

texts.en:
Monhtuya is 34 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (a traditional yurt) in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Batmunh, works in a private construction company as an assistant worker. Her daughter, Bolortsetseg, age of 14, is a secondary school student. 

Monhtuya has been running a business of organic vegetable sales in the local food market for seven years. She is a diligent, hardworking and responsible woman. She has gained a lot of experience in the organic vegetable sales business. 

She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to reserve a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in her rental counter at the local food market.

loans.use: to reserve a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in her rental counter at the local food market.

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en:
Bintiomari is without a doubt a brave, hardworking woman; she says she’s humble, honest and tenacious and that she loves her family.  She is a widowed mother of six children.  What’s important for her is to move her family forward. 

Bintiomari operates as kiosk where she sells basic household items and also stocks vegetables for sell.  The loan she’s asked  Yehu for is to buy instant goods and more vegetables to sell.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals and have a prosperous life some day. 

She’s aware that she can reach her dream but must work to do so which is why everyday she gets up thanking God for one more day of life in which she can work to reach her dream.

loans.use: to buy instant goods and more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 51 year old, widow who lives in Tangub City having 3 children.  She earns a living through food and home used products vending. 

She has been doing this business for 20 years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from this work.  Juanita has applied for a loan of PHP 4,500 at GDMPC to purchase new items such as candies, snack foods, etc. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009.  She hopes to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, snack foods, etc

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a forty-two year farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and three children, who are all in school. She has been farming for over twenty years, producing tea, milk, peas, vegetables and beans that she sells in the local market.

She is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chaff cutter, which will help her to prepare enough feed for her dairy cows, and thus to produce more milk and increase her income, so that she can improve her standard of living and pay for her children's school fees. 

High costs of feed and the small size of her piece of land are her major challenges in farming.

Rosemary is grateful for the assistance that Juhudi Kilimo is giving to farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter to prepare feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish selling business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Marcela is requesting a loan from NWTF for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.  In the future, Marcela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 24 years old, single, and has one child.  She is a farmer in Nkubu,  Kenya, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She raises cash crops and cereals, which she sells at the local market in her area.

Fridah is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase a water tank that will assist her in conserving enough water to irrigate her crops when there is no rainfall.  This loan will help to increase her produce and income after selling her products.   Fridah will be able to improve her livelihood and pay school fees for her child.  Poor climatic conditions, poor markets, and lack of capital are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for irrigation.

loans.name: Qamile

texts.en:
Qamile is a lady from the vulnerable Egyptian community of south central Albania and she is married. She has grandchildren whom she adores, especially the little granddaughter photographed with her and her husband, Ferit.

Qamile has been working as a dressmaker for the past 20 years, not only for her community but for other communities as well. In addition to this activity, her husband sells used clothes in the market. The income they both generate is not bad at all, Ferit said; they even help their children.

Qamile and Ferit now want to buy a washing machine and for this they need some 50,000 Albanian Lek. This will be a tremendous help to them since they raise their grandchildren themselves and of course there is so much laundry to do.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on quality used clothes and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is from the village of Eniseli in East Georgia. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and 22-year-old son. Alina’s husband works locally as an artisan, and he has a monthly income. Her mother-in-law receives a retirement pension. Alina runs a small dairy farm, consisting of a milk cow and two calves. She milks the cow and produces cheese with the milk. Besides her agricultural activities, Alina works as a baker at the local bakery to earn a monthly salary. She works hard to save and improve her family’s living conditions. 
Alina wants to make some repairs and improvements to her old house, but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to cover the costs of house repairs, such as changing windows, painting, etc. This loan will enable Alina and her family to have suitable living conditions and to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to renovate her old house so that she and her family will have a suitable place to live and enjoy living in their house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is from Prenza, Tangub City.  She is 36 years old and married, with 5 children.  Maria cultivates bananas to earn an income for her family.  Maria has had her business for more than 6 years and earns 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month.  Maria joined GDMPC in 2011.  She is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is married and has 5 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Znac, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Concepcion sells food for snacks to earn a living and has this business for 7 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Concepcion hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Namhia

texts.en:
Namhia is 50 years old and lives with her youngest son in a house in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. Her older children got married and moved out from her house. Her youngest son, Puntsag, age 15, is a secondary school student. 

She has been operating a grocery store business at a rental counter of the local market since 2010. Her business is now stable and she has built strong relationships with customers and suppliers over the last two years. 

She is now expanding her product range into dairy products and she is also starting to produce organic dried curds to sell at her counter. She needs additional investment of 5,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic milk and dairy products to increase her sales during winter and spring, which lack in supply of dairy products. She is a diligent and hardworking person who says, "I want my son to graduate university with better education."

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic milk and dairy products to increase her sales during winter and spring, which lack in supply of dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona is married and has four children. Elona is 39 years old and resides at Labuyo, Tangub City. 

Elona plants and harvests corn that she sells to the local community to earn a living, and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 11,500 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In 2010, Elona joined GDMPC. In the future, Elona wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 28-year-old gentleman who supports his schooling siblings. He is a livestock trader in Nkareta area and has been running the business for the past three years, making a monthly income of KES 20,000

He has borrowed his fifth loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., with which he intends to purchase more livestock for resale. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. His future dream is to improve his living standards

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en: Mgeni is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children who range in age from 3 years to 7 years old. She describes herself as a business-oriented woman, and earns a living by operating a stall where she sells food, snacks and tea. She has been in this business for five years, and works in a very busy area making sales mostly to people who live nearby. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient funds to improve her business. She will use this loan, which is for Kes 20,000, to buy ingredients she needs to prepare foods for sale. Her goal is to improve her business within five years. In the future, she hopes to run a large hotel.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make handicraft decorations.

loans.name: Arnie

texts.en:
Arnie is 29 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.  Arnie works in the fish industry, buying and selling fish for a living, which she has been doing for five years. 

Arnie is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell.  She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Arnie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 37 years old. Genalyn is married and has 3 children. She sells fish while her husband does fishing. She has been in business for 15 years and earns 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. In 2009, Genalyn joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new hooks & nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new hooks & nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Uwezo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kadagoyi, leader du groupe d’affaire «Uwezo», est un ancien entrepreneur, âgée de 49 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants qui étudient, cependant difficilement. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est vendeuse de souliers. Il y a 11 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Elle a reçu son premier capital de la part de son mari. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 4eme crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 25 paires de souliers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et ouvrir une boutique. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Kadagoyi, age 49, is the leader of the business group Uwezo and a long-time entrepreneur. She is a married mother of four children who attend school, albeit with some difficulty. Her husband is unemployed. She sells shoes, and has been engaged in small-scale income-generating activities for the past 11 years. She originally received her starting capital from her husband. 

She has just obtained a fourth loan from Hekima. She will use this new credit to buy 25 pairs of shoes.  

She wants to provide her children with a comfortable upbringing, and she would like to open a store. She wishes to thank Hekima for helping impoverished women who do not have access to traditional banking channels.

loans.use: to buy 25 pairs of shoes for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: 03-01-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Ms. Dẻo operates a food stall/restaurant selling prepared food. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and pork and other ingredients to prepare food to sell. Dẻo has been involved in this business for four years.

Dẻo is 56 years old and is single with one child. Her child is grown up so Dẻo supports no dependents in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Dẻo is the group leader of the 03-01-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of six members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Dẻo faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Dẻo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy the rice and meat to prepare for sale, as well as to buy vegetables, fruits, dried goods on sale.

loans.name: 03-02-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu has a retail business selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. Thu has been involved in this business for eight years.

Thu is 37 years old. She is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

In 2012, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thu is the group leader of the 03-02-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of eight members. Thu has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
 
The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: 03-01-02-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Tuyên has a retail business selling fruits and vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell. Tuyên has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Tuyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children. She supports them with her business, which is in  Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Now, she is the group leader of the 03-01-02-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. This is Tuyên first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Tuyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: 08-Ts3-10-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Ngân operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells snacks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Ngân faces in her business is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to make snacks. 

Ngân is 30 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. 

This is Ngân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 08-TS3-10-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. With her anticipated profits, Ngân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase pork to make snacks.

loans.name: 3.14.199.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Phong works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and to sell in the future.

Phong is 56 years old and married with one child. Her child is grown up, so Phong supports no dependents with her business, which is in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Phong is the group leader of the 3.14.199.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2011, Phong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Phong hopes to maintain a successful business. She also hopes for her child to find a good job and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and to sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.14.200.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Dân has a service business in clothing sales. She has been involved in this business for five years and is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell. She is 35 years old and married with two children.

Dân is the group leader of the 3.14.200.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She supports two dependents with her business, located in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Dân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Dân hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to build a new house and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: 3.11.201.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Thơm works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for seven years and she is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and to sell in the future.

Thơm is 35 years old and married with two children. She supports two dependents with her business, located in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thơm is the group leader of the 3.11.201.Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2010, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, she hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and to sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.11.202.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Thủy works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, and has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thủy is 39 years old and is married with three children. One of her children is grown up so Thủy supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. One of the most critical business challenges that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2010, Thủy joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid three loans from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 3.11.202.thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of seven members.

With her business profits, Thủy hopes to maintain a successful business, for the business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: 06.08.01 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy has a retail business selling incense and ghost money. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make these votive objects to resell.

Thủy is 48 years old, married and has two children. Thủy is the group leader of the 06.08.01 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa, a city in Thanh Hoa province. One of her children is a dependent and one child is grown up. In 2010, Thủy joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid three loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main challenge that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit Thủy hopes that she can help her children find good jobs, that her business will do well, and that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material to make votive objects to resell.

loans.name: 06.02.03 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Liên has a retail business selling incense and ghost money. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make votive objects to sell.

Liên is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 06.02.03 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Liên lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Liên hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material to make votive objects to sell.

loans.name: 06.07.08 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Điệp operates a food stall selling meat and has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicken and ducks to resell.

Điệp is 30 years old and is married with two dependent children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 06.07.08 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members. The main hardship that Điệp faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2010, Điệp joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business, and has since successfully repaid three loans.

With the profits from her business, Điệp hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to go on a vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and ducks to resell.

loans.name: 06.07.04 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Huệ has a business selling items in her general store. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sweet candy, milk, soap, and other items to re-sell.

Huệ is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 06.07.04 Đông Vệ solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2012, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huệ has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Huệ has been involved in her business for 9 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Huệ hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet candy, milk, and soap for her business

loans.name: 09.01.11 Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Nhàn is 56 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Nhàn is the group leader of the 09.01.11 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group, which consists of five members.

Nhàn has a general store and has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sweets, candy, milk and soap to resell. This is Nhàn's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

In the future, Nhàn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to go on a vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, candy, milk and soap to resell.

loans.name: 3.11.203.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Nghi works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Nghi is 52 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 3.11.203.thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Two of her children are grown up so Nghi supports 1 dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2005, Nghi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her are illnesses.

With her business profit, Nghi hopes for her children to find a good job, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.11.204.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Hưng works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase young poultry to raise and sell.

Hưng is 46 years old, married, and has one child. She supports her family with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Hưng is the group leader of the 3.11.204.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2008, Hưng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hưng has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hưng has been involved in her business for more than ten years. The most critical business difficulty that concerns her is illness.

With her business profit, Hưng hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase young poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: 070402Thôn 6 - Hoằng Thịnh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lạc works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

Lạc is 51 years old married with three children.
She is the leader of a four-member group, the 070402 Thôn 6 - Hoằng Thịnh solidarity group. 
Two children of her are grown up so Lạc supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Lạc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lạc has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Lạc  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main harship that Lạc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Lạc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: 030316Trung Hải- Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Nguyệt works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to re-sell.

Nguyệt is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She supports her family with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 030316 Trung Hải- Hoằng Thanh solidarity group.

In 2005, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nguyệt  has been involved in her business for eight years. The main hardship that she faces is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nguyệt hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to re-sell

loans.name: Hongor

texts.en: Mrs.Hongor is 43 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband Zorigoo helps her to manage her business. Her oldest son got married and moved out of parents' Ger. Her daughter Enhjargal, 22 years old, works in private company, daughter Dariimaa and son Zaluuhuu, age of 18 and 14 are secondary school students. She has been managing various types of businesses and she is a herder now and producing organic dairy products for local customers. She has a dream of having a cattle farm to produce various types of organic dairy products. She is requesting 2'000'000MNT to purchase cattle to increase her organic dairy products production. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "I need my younger 2 children to graduate good universities with highly educated and I am started saving money to cover their university expenses, so I need to increase my income and profit"

loans.use: to purchase cattle to increase her organic dairy products production

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo con la intención de poder superarse y salir adelante, dejar toda la pobreza y así ayudar a sus familias, ellas son  trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
Una de estas mujeres es Limpia, ella tiene un salón de belleza muy concurrido. Limpia cuenta que le va muy bien ya que hace siempre muy buenos trabajos y que eso le da muy buena publicidad con las personas y que así se va haciendo camino y se hace conocida. Su meta es poder tener un gran salón de belleza, ya que quiere poder dar trabajo a otras personas que lo necesiten.
Pide de este crédito para poder abastecerse y tener todos los elementos que más necesita para poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, como ser tintes, tijeras, shampoo, enjuagues y demás productos de primera necesidad para su trabajo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed with the intention of seeing its members become successful and move forward. Despite living in poverty, they all want to help their families. The members are hardworking and humble women who desire to make a living each day.

One of these women is Limpia, who manages a busy beauty salon. She is doing very well and has always done good work. One reason for this is that she has done a good job of promoting her business to other people. This has helped her forge a path to becoming recognized. Her goal is to have a large beauty salon because she wants to provide jobs to other people who need them.

Limpia is requesting a loan because she needs to restock all of the supplies that she uses most in providing good service to her customers. These items include dyes, scissors, shampoo, rinses, and other products that are used often in her work.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, shampoo, rinses, and other supplies.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is married and the father of five children who range in age from one to 20 years old. He describes himself as determined and focused, and earns a living by raising livestock such as sheep, goats and cows. He has been involved in this business for 15 years and works in a busy area selling his goods mostly to local residents. He describes his biggest challenge as insufficient funds to improve his business. He will use this loan, which is for Kes. 20,000, to buy livestock to sell. His business goal is to be a supplier of livestock to other major towns  within five years. In the future, he also hopes to run a butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy more cows to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota is 35 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Sta Cruz, Tangub City. Carlota raises pigs and hogs, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns an income of 3,000 PHP per month. 

Carlota is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds.  She became a member of GDMPC in 2010. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is taking out a new loan to expand her retail shop. She says that her inventory has gone down and she wants to increase it. With this new investment, she is sure to increase sales and income for a better life. 

Thanks to her efforts and determination, she was able to provide her children with better living standards due to the increased income from the previous investment. 

Kache aims at having a life where she does not lack anything in her home. She will buy flour, basic grains, cleaning items, and instant goods with the loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, basic grains, cleaning items, and instant goods for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks, such as sugar, sticky rice, cheese, and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used shoes to re-sell.

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah is 43 years old, married, and her seven children are aged between five and 18 years old. She hawks milk in Chemundu and has been in operation for a period of eight years, earning an income of 8,000 KES monthly.

Lenah is servicing her first loan of 10,000 KES from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to pay the milk suppliers. The profits she earns will be used to put back into her business. 

She hopes for improved living standards for her family and prosperity in her business.

loans.use: to pay the milk suppliers.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy, age 37, is from Prenza, Tangub City. She is married and has four children. 

To earn a living, Joy has a banana production business. Joy has been in her business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Joy joined GDMPC. Joy is requesting a loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her pump boat.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Helen has a business selling of longganisa (pork sausage flavored with indigenous spices). She earns about 2,500 a month. 

Helen is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business.  She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Helen would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is 23 years old and lives in Nablus. He owns a barbershop in a refugee camp and works hard to earn enough money to help support his family and brothers. He is requesting a youth loan from Ryada in order to buy furniture and enlarge his barbershop. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the number of customers he serves and provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy furniture and enlarge his barbershop.

loans.name: Enyanya Group

texts.fr: Maheshe est une femme courage de l’association Enyanya. Agée de 50ans et mère de 9 enfants est mariée à un homme sans emploi. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits vivriers depuis plus de 5ans. Son professionnalisme dans le secteur lui a amené à solliciter ce credit pour renforcer son capital. Sur ceux elle remercie Hekima pour son appui.
texts.en: Maheshe is a courageous woman from the association Enyanya. A 50-year-old woman and the mother of nine children, she is married to a man who is unemployed. She has been a vendor of staple foods for over five years. Her professionalism in the sector has lead her to request this loan for bolstering her capital. She thanks the microfinance institution Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to purchase a box of canned tomatoes, a sack of sugar,....

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products and a wheelchair

loans.name: Edwin Martin

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin tiene 32 años y es soltero, el se dedica al servicio de impresiones fotográficas, el vive en la zona de Piñami de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Edwin va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de una impresora de imprenta por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es quiere actualizar su equipo de trabajo para la impresión de fotos de buena calidad  que por la falta de efectivo no la podía comprar y el préstamo le hacía mucha falta, Edwin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen muchos fotógrafos en las distintos acontecimientos sociales en los que trabaja y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando cámaras fotográficas y demás equipos y materiales que necesita y su deseo es tener un estudio fotográfico con todos los equipos modernos para brindar a su clientela un servicio de calidad.
texts.en:
Edwin is 32, single, and offers photo printing services. He lives in the Piñami neighborhood of Cochabamba. This loan will be his first with the institution. Edwin will use the loan to buy a printer for the high quality photo printing service he wants to start; right now he lacks the cash to do so. 

Edwin faces competition for the service from other experienced photographers. He wants to use his profits to buy more cameras and other necessary equipment and supplies. He wants to have a photography studio with modern equipment so that he can offer his clients superior service.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Gulisar

texts.ru: Гулисар 42 года, замужем. Мать 3 детей. Гулисар в качестве основного дохода с 2002 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 50,000 KGS. Основным видом деятельности является продажа мяса и молока. Благодаря упорному труду Гулисар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 дойные коровы и 5 бычков, ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом. В Бизнесе Гулисар активно помогают дочь и муж. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулисар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков и 2 коровы. Бычков для откорма и последующего забоя а коров для увеличения надоя  молока.  Доходы от кредита Гулисар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса. Увеличить количество коров и бычков. Гулисар поделилась, что в ближайшее время собирается выдать замуж дочку.
texts.en: Gulisar is 42 years old, married and a mother of three children.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 2002, having started this business with 50,000 KGS.  The main business focus is selling meat and milk.  Thanks to Gulisar's hard work, today her business contains four dairy cows and five bulls, and the monthly income amounts to 8,000 som.  Her daughter and husband actively help her with the business.  In order to further develop her business, Gulisar requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy two bulls and two cows.  The bulls will be used for fattening up and subsequent butchering, and the cows for increasing milk volumes.  Gulisar plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest into a further expansion of her business by increasing the quantity of cows and bulls.  Gulisar shared with us that she plans to marry off her daughter in the near future.

loans.use: to buy two bulls and two cows

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Dulamsuren is 52 years old and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandson in a house in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. Her husband, Ganhuyag, aged 55, works with her in a food store in the local market. Her son got married this year and both he and his wife are unemployed. Her grandson stays at home with his parents. 

Dulamsuren has been managing various types of businesses for a living over the years. She is a hard-working, optimistic and diligent person who says that: "the grocery store business is lot more profitable than any other business that I have run in the past. It will be able to make enough money to cover my family's expenses and to save for my nephew's future". 

Dulamsuren is planning to open a general store at a rented counter in the local market. She is requesting a loan of 3,800,000 MNT to pay for the initial inventory and rent for her new grocery store business.

loans.use: to pay for the initial inventory and rent for her new grocery store business.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. His wife, Suvdaa, is 44 and works as a saleswoman at a children's clothes shop in a local shopping centre. His daughter, Odvogmedmaa, aged 11, is a primary school student and his son, Gan-Erdene, aged 2, goes to kindergarten. 

Gantulga has been managing a wooden furniture manufacturing business since 2006 and he has experience in specialised Ger (Mongolian dwelling) manufacturing. Gantuga has built close relationships with his customers. He is a communicative and hardworking person. He is now planning to start a welding business as part of his furniture production business, since welding is necessary for his business and more profitable. 

Gantulka is requesting 1,800,000 Mongolian Tugriks to purchase equipment, tools and inventory for his new welding business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, tools and inventory for his new welding business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 22 years old and comes from Nablus. He is a worker and works in lifting construction materials for buildings. 

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a winch for lifting the materials. He hopes that his work will develop and that his income will be improved.

loans.use: to buy a winch for lifting the materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is from Prenza, Tangub City. She is 30 years old. Antonia is married and has three children. To make a living, Antonia grows corn for sale. Antonia been in farming for 6 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Antonia joined GDMPC. Antonia is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a retail store where she sells daily use items such as sugar, salt, maize flour, cooking fat, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a populated business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Domitila describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more items to sell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy daily use items

loans.name: Ariunjargal

texts.en:
Ariunjargal is 46 years old lives in the 'ger' district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He operates a carpentry business with his wife in their home province. He manufactures wooden furniture and his wife helps with the business. They produce a variety of wooden furniture products including chairs, tables, sofas and wardrobes. This autumn his house burned down. 

Before the winter he wants to reconstruct his burned wooden house. He is planning to use bricks to thicken house walls from the outside and basalt wool from the inside. He plans to exchange the broken windows for double-glazed windows to stop the heat loss and exchange his house interior decoration using energy-saving materials. He wants to install a low-pressure furnace which generates fewer harmful chemicals into the atmosphere in order to save the environment.

loans.use: to reconstruct his burned wooden house

loans.name: Wangoni

texts.en: Wangoni is a very hardworking person who has gotten his family ahead through great efforts. He is taking out a new loan to invest in his current clothes-selling business. He has gained a lot of experience in this field, but because of significant financial difficulties he needs this loan to buy more clothing to sell to his customers. His dream is to have a shop where he can work, because this would increase his sales and allow him to generate more income and offer his family a better quality of life. Wangoni appreciates the support he is receiving, especially this new loan. He promises to repay his loan punctually so that he can continue to take out loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 35 years old and lives in Gaza. He is married, lives with his wife and seven children and earns a living by running a small grocery store. He has been in this line of work since 2010 and is requesting a loan to buy a display refrigerator and food for his store. He hopes that this loan will increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator and food for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to resell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is 59 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has five children. To earn a living, Yolanda has a business selling tempura. She earns about 1,000 PHP each month doing this work. Yolanda has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients for her tempura business. Yolanda has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Yolanda would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her tempura business

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Madame Rokhaya est une femme divorcée qui vit au Sénégal. Elle évolue depuis 1 an dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de de tissus et d’habits. Grâce aux revenus que lui procure son activité elle parvient a prendre en charge la nourriture et le transport de sa famille. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et d’habits destinés a renforcer son stock. Son vœu est d’accroitre ses bénéfices afin de pouvoir épargner davantage.
texts.en: Ms. Rokhaya is a divorced woman who lives in Senegal. For a year, she has been working in commerce selling fabrics and clothing. Thanks to the revenues her business brings in, she manages to cover the food and transport costs for her family. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to purchase fabrics and clothing for bolstering her inventory. Her wish is to increase her profits to be able to save more money.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and clothing

loans.name: Oumou Khairy

texts.fr:
Oumoukhaïry est une femme mariée.Elle gère une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques au marché central de sa localité.
Elle parvient à générer des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que les besoins alimentaires, sanitaires et divers de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 300 000f pour acheter des tissus et des produits cosmétiques
.
texts.en: Oumou Khaïry is a married woman. She runs a shop selling cosmetic products at the central market of her town. She manages to generate the revenues enabling her to meet her own needs, as well as the food, healthcare, and other needs of her family. To bolster her working capital, she is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to purchase fabrics and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr:
Balla est un homme marié, père de trois enfants. Il pratique le commerce de bœuf dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.Ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien
.
Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter 1 boeuf.
texts.en:
Balla is a married man and father to three children. He sells oxen in the weekly markets of his locale. This business allows him to meet the needs of his family and to take care of the maintenance costs.

In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 200,000f to buy an ox.

loans.use: to buy an ox.

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru: Виталий - водитель такси. Он ездит на своей машине, перевозит пасажиров по городу и по Украине. Клиент трудолюбив, предприимчив. Он уже пользовался бизнес кредитами и всегда вовремя их выплачивал. В этот раз кредит понадобился для ремонта машины - необходимо отремонтировать ходовую часть перед зимним сезоном.
texts.en: Vitaliy is a taxi driver.  He drives his own car and transports passengers around the city and around Ukraine.  The client is hardworking and entrepreneurial.  He has already used business loans and always paid them back on time.  This time he needs a loan to make car repairs - it is necessary to repair the undercarriage in advance of the winter season.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Khuyagbaatar

texts.en:
Khuyagbaatar is 25 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar. Now his family is living in his father's wooden house. His family income is not enough to improve his family's living condition. That’s way he got in rent his own house. He is an architect for a local company in Ulaanbaatar. 

Khyagbaatar is asking 5,000,000 MNT to buy a car, which runs on gas. The gas emits fewer harmful chemicals into the atmosphere than petrol. The car will be used by the family.

loans.use: to buy a car that runs on gas.

loans.name: Duger

texts.en:
Duger is a 56-year-old woman. She lives in the town of Ulaanbaatar. To make a living, Duger owns and operates a jewelry business. Duger has been engaged in this business for over six years. Duger's jewelry stand is located in a jewelry store with about 15 other female vendors. Similar to the other sellers, Duger mostly sells silver earrings, necklaces and ring sets. She says that a lot of her inventory is imported from other countries, like Turkey, Thailand, and China.

Duger joined Credit Mongol LLC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 tugrug. This loan, her third from Credit Mongol LLC, will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Duger plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her jewelry business.

loans.use: to purchase new jewelry items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is 44 years old lives with son in GER Mongolian traditional tent in ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar. She is master in tailoring factory since 2006. Her son is accountant in local company. 

 Altantuya wants to buy a car for son. The car will be used for personal needs. The car, which all Mongolian people’s using, has too big engine, so it uses 10-12 liter petrol per 100 kilometer. The study showed that average car, which runs on petrol, emits 135g CO2 per km to atmosphere. And also the petrol contains harmful ingredients like zinc, lead and others, to people’s health and the environment. Economically, riding a car with big engine in Mongolia is not rational, because Mongolia imports fuel products from the neighbors and its price always rises. 

Altantuya is asking a loan to buy a car, which runs on a natural gas. She already paid part of the money, but still owes 3,500,000 MNT to the seller. The reason he is asking for this loans is to pay the rest of the money for her car. The natural gas emits fewer harmful chemicals into the atmosphere than petrol. Altantuya and her son will contribute their effort to save the environment.

loans.use: to buy a car, which runs on a natural gas.

loans.name: Delgerkhangai

texts.en:
Delgerkhangai is 38 years old and has continuously worked as a driver in the military since 2010: his wife also works in the military. His family consists of five members: his wife and three children. They live in their small wooden house in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and erratic electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

By saving money, they  bought a plot of land in a remote part of the city where they built their house. In winter, the heat goes out through the door and the house gets colder, so they need to use a coal-burning stove to keep warm. Coal burning is becoming the primary source of air pollution in Mongolia. 

Therefore, Delgerkhangai is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT so a small barn can be built where the house door opens outside. By doing this,  the heat loss will be reduced, he will burn less coal, and his family will live in comfortable conditions.

loans.use: to build a small barn where the house door opens outside

loans.name: Tuyana

texts.ru: Туяна торгует на центральном рынке  и имеет два торговых места.  Туяна торгует женской одеждой, носками, чулками, кофтами, футболками, колготами. Туяна - успешный предприниматель, она всегда находится  на своем торговом месте, у нее всегда большой выбор товара, низние цены. Кредит понадобился для закупки товара и пополнения ассортимента товара. Туяна очень пунктуальна. Она уже пользовалась бизнес кредитами и всегда вовремя их выплачивала.
texts.en: Tuyana trades at the central market and has two sales locations.  Tuyana sells women's clothing: socks, pantyhose, cardigans, tshirts and tights.  Tuyana is a successful entrepreneur, she is always at her sales location, she always has a large selection of products and low prices.  She needs a loan to purchase products and increase her product assortment.  Tuyana is very punctual.  She has already used business loans and always paid them back on time.

loans.use: to expand winter product offerings

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru: Галина использовала предыдущий кредит для закупки посуды, продав которую она получила дополнительную прибыль. В этот раз Галина также хочет закупить дополнительную партию посуды - кастрюли и сковородки. Приближаются праздники - сезон подарков - и ее товар будет пользоваться повышенным спросом. Галина хочет использовать эту бизнес возможность.
texts.en: Galina used her previous loan to purchase dishes, having sold them she earned additional income.  This time Galina would also like to purchase an additional lot of dishes - pots and pans.  The holidays are coming - the season of gifts - and her products are in higher demand.  Galina would like to take advantage of this business opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase an additional lot of dishes for the holidays

loans.name: Lina

texts.ru: Лина торгует конфетами на центральном рынке. Она арендует 2 торговые точки. На одной работает сама, на другой у нее наемный работник. Бизнес идет успешно.  Лина трудолюбива, у нее много товара, хороший ассортимент. В связи с приближением праздников Лине необходимо закупить большую партию шоколада. Для этого она просит предоставить ей кредит 4000 гривен.
texts.en: Lina sells candy at the central market.  She rents two sales locations.  She works at one of them and has an employee at the other.  The business is doing well.  Lina is hardworking, she has a lot of products and a good selection.  Because of the coming holidays Lina needs to purchase a large lot of chocolates.  She is asking for a loan of 4,000  hryvnia.

loans.use: to purchase a large lot of chocolates for the holidays

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne is a 47-year-old mother of four. She has been trained as a puppeteer and in children’s theater. After working through a special educational program in area schools, Suzanne began operating puppet shows and children’s activities. She is working with area nursery schools and kindergartens and for private events. In addition to the puppet shows, Suzanne creates amazing murals. Suzanne has birthday, special event, and classroom programs including puppet-making and mural designs. 

Suzanne needs this loan for a sound system, a stock of puppets to sell, and material for activities and creating puppets.

Suzanne dreams of one day creating a full children’s puppet theater in her area.

loans.use: to purchase a sound system, a stock of puppets to sell, and material for activities and creating puppets.

loans.name: Pura Calidad Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Pura Calidad” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; kiosko, vendedores ambulantes, venta de helados, venta de dulces, venta de maní, feriantes, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Marlene, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una jardinera de color verde y una polera de color negra, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa usada, desde hace 10 años. Comenta que trabaja fuera de un supermercado de lunes a domingos, a veces trabaja 12 horas seguidas, la acompaña su esposolos dias que trabaja hasta mas tarde, ofrece todo tipo de ropa para adultos de muy buena calidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando para abastecer su negocio la compra en locales adheridos con ropa de segunda mano en buen estado y a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa, como blusas, camisas, poleras, chaquetas.
Una de las metas de Marlene es ampliar su rubro y llegar a tener una boutique, así generar mayores ingresos y optar por una mejor calidad de vida.
Marlene vive junto a su esposo, sus suegros y tres hijas de 15, 14 y 11 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener su casa propia y darles una buena educación a sus hijas.
Ella está agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le abrió una puerta laboral y le permitirá invertir en su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is Pura Calidad. It comprises sixteen entrepreneurs who work in different trades, such as: working at a kiosk, as traveling merchants, selling ice cream, selling sweets, selling peanuts, and offering other services. They all belong to the municipality of Independencia, located in greater Santiago.

Marlene is a member of this communal bank. She is standing in the second row of the picture, the third person from the left. She is wearing green overalls and a black top. She has dark brown hair and is wearing it tied back.

She has worked selling used clothing for ten years. She says she works outside a supermarket Monday through Sunday, sometimes for twelve straight hours. Her husband and a friend help her with sales. She offers all types of high quality clothing for men and women. She purchases whatever merchandise she needs to stock her business from affiliated stores that sell used clothing in good condition at low cost, which is the best option for her financially. She will use the loan to purchase clothing like blouses, shirts, t-shirts, and jackets.

One of Marlene's goals is to expand her business and open her own boutique, so that she may generate more income and achieve a better quality of life.

Marlene lives with her husband, her in-laws, and three daughters who are in school. They are fifteen, fourteen, and eleven years old. On a family level, her dream is to own her own home and give her daughters a good education.

She is grateful and happy with the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has offered her, since it has opened a door for her business and allows her to invest in her work and also in her personal development, because she has learned how to better organize and distribute her income and investments.

Independencia is one of 34 municipalities that make up the city of Santiago, the capital of Chile, and is located in the central-north area. It was developed in the late nineteenth century as a traditional sector of the city. Its main thoroughfare is Av. Independencia, which used to be the old Camino del Inca, leading to the North entrance to the city of Santiago. Due to its large indigenous population, the Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile is located in Independencia. There are also important historical buildings, including six of Chile's historic monuments.

loans.use: to purchase clothing like blouses, shirts, t-shirts, and jackets.

loans.name: Iveta

texts.en:
Iveta is 44 years old and lives in the Vani District with her son. She is widowed and provided with a small pension. Iveta requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. All her loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Iveta earns a monthly income working in cleaning services, but it is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Iveta requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. With the received credit, Iveta will trade in clothing. She plans to buy clothing from wholesalers and sell it in Vani district. The new business, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. 

This start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor. Poor rural families do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Vencedores Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad encarnación está empezando a trabajar juntas y están en su primer ciclo. Ellas desean poder aprender y tener la oportunidad de ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra Zunilda, está acompañada con el señor Egidio de profesión mecánico, tienen 2 hijos, quienes son el motivo de lucha de esta pareja. Ambos trabajan arduamente por sus hijos, ya que quieren que ellos el día de mañana sean personas de bien. Zunilda tiene una despensa en la que trabaja desde muy temprano y así ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, enlatados, leche, panificados y demás productos, ya que ella quiere poder dar a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan y piden.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación has started working together and is in its first loan cycle. The members want to learn and have the opportunity to help their families through their businesses.

One of the members is Sra. Zunilda. She is married to Sr. Egidio, who is a mechanic by profession. They have two children who serve as the motivation behind their efforts as a couple. Both of them work hard to provide for their children so that one day they will grow up to become good people.

Zunilda manages a food pantry and begins her work very early. This enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy vegetables, fruits, canned goods, milk, baked goods, and other products. Zunilda wants to offer everything that her customers need and request.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, canned goods, milk, baked goods, and other products.

loans.name: Imilya

texts.ru:
Имилия торгует женской одеждой и обувью. Она использовала предыдущий кредит для расширения ассортимента и смогла получить дополнительную прибыль, которую потратила на улучшение своих жилищных условий.

На этот раз кредит понадобился для закупки зимней женской одежды, а так же зимних женских сапог. Имилия надеется, что большой ассортимент товара привлечет больше покупателей.
texts.en:
Imiliya sells women's clothes and shoes. She used a previous loan to expand her store's stock and was able to earn additional profits, which she used to improve her living conditions. 

This loan is needed to purchase women's winter clothes and boots. Imilya hopes that a wide selection of goods will attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy winter women's clothes and boots

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: Esta es la alcancía comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE MICAELA BASTIDAS”, es un grupo conformado por 7 socios caracterizados por ser luchadores y persistentes en la vida, con el fin de poder lograr concretar sus metas. La Sra. Silvia es la mujer que aparece en el lado izquierdo de la foto, vistiendo una casaca azul. Ella tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos ya mayores de edad. Silvia se dedica a vender productos de belleza para así poder tener sustentos económicos que la ayuden a salir adelante; Así mismo en víspera navideña se dedica a vender productos como, arboles navideños, pequeños adornos alusivos a navidad y también juguetes para niños. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de los productos navideños ya mencionados, para luego poder comercializarla en su hogar y también en un punto de mercado muy concurrido. Ella junto a los demás integrantes del grupo “Mujeres emprendedoras de Micaela Bastidas” agradecen de corazón a todas las personas que ayudan por medio Kiva y Edaprospo para poder ayudar hacer realidad sus proyectos.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE MICAELA BASTIDAS” (Micaela Bastidas’ Entrepreneurial Women). It’s a group consisting of 7 members known for their determination and persistence in life, to accomplish their goals. Silvia is the woman who appears on the left side of the photo wearing a blue coat. She is 55 years old, married and has 6 children who are now all older. Silvia sells beauty products in order to have an economic livelihood that helps her get ahead. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of Christmas products such as Christmas trees, ornaments, and children's toys so that later she can sell them in her home as well as in a busy market. She, along with the other members of the group “Mujeres emprendedoras de Micaela Bastidas”, thank with all their hearts everyone who has helped through Kiva and Edaprospo to help them achieve their projects.

loans.use: to purchase Christmas trees, ornaments, and children's toys

loans.name: La Vecindad Del Cinco Group

texts.es: Hola desde ¡Perú! El grupo que se visualiza en la foto es de la “Vecindad del Cinco”, conformado por 5 socias muy alegres, perseverantes y con un espíritu de lucha único. La Sra. Elsa es una mujer muy sociable en particular, se puede observar que en la foto aparece con vestimenta azul en la parte izquierda. Ella tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, los cuales solo 2 dependen de ella. Ella por la necesidad de progresar y poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, decidió implementar parte de su hogar y así iniciar un negocio de comida "Restaurante", ya que posee una exquisita sazón_; además esta es su actividad principal; como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de adornos; pero solo en ocasiones especiales como fiestas patrias y navidad;El préstamo actual lo utilizará en compra de productos navideños tales como adornos, juguetes. El grupo “Vecindad del Cinco” agradece a todas las personas que ayudan a través de Kiva y Edaprospo. La Sra. Elsa da un testimonio personal y dice: “Me siento alegre y contenta, que personas de diferentes parte del mundo puedan ayudarme a seguir creciendo como persona, mujer y madre; Promete seguir adelante y  que dentro de muy pronto desea poder aperturar un local de comida más grande y compartir esta historia con ustedes”.
texts.en:
Hello from Peru! The group in the photo is the "Vecindad del Cinco " (Neighborhood of Five), which consists of five very happy, persevering members with a spirit of working as one. Señora Elsa in particular is very sociable. In the photo she can be seen dressed in blue, on the left. She is 39 years old, is married, and has four children, of whom only two depend on her. Out of the need to progress and be able to give a better quality of life to her children, she decided to outfit part of her house and thus begin a food business, since she has a good sense of taste.
