This is her 8th loan.  She was punctual and responsible because it was about money that helped her very much in her short-term goals and she plans to continue being part of MFP.  She is grateful to her communal bank fellow members for always being very responsible people because thanks to this they are a very solid group.  She will use the 2,000 new soles to buy a cooler to start the gelatin and cold beverage business.

loans.use: to buy a cooler to start a cold beverage business.

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa Antonia tiene 47 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo que tiene 23 años en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
ESTA VRC SAN ANTONIO, SUS MIEMBROS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA TODOS VIVEN EN EL SECTOR DEL RECINTO AGUAS FRIAS. PRACTICAMENTE SE HAN CRIADO EN ESA ZONA, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIAS EN SU MAYORIA.
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas de. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventana.
El sueño es que el hijo llegue hacer un gran profesional y sea un buen hijo. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades de los cultivos y animales. En el tiempo libre le gusta escribir cartas a amistad a los amigos y familiares.
texts.en:
Rosa Antonia is 47 years old, single, and has a son. She lives with her son, who is 23, in the city of Ventanas in De Los Rios province. The members of the San Antonio communal bank work in agriculture. They all live around the rural settlement of Aguas Frias. Almost all of them have grown up in that area, and the majority work in agriculture and livestock-raising.

Rosa Antonia is a farmer, growing corn and raising chickens. She is applying for the loan in order to buy insecticides, urea and herbicides.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy seeds. She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is for her son to become a fine professional. The challenges she faces are crop and animal diseases. In her free time she likes to write letters to friends and family members.

loans.use: To buy insecticides, urea and herbicides.

loans.name: Destin

texts.en:
Kiosk-Kiosk LLC is part of the digital signage industry that offers “a variety of communication objects which serves many purposes including branding companies, advertising work, promotions, information, entertainment, educational information, and employee communication,” says owner Destin, who sells custom billboard-style kiosks in his hometown of Alexandria, LA. 

Destin has always been an entrepreneur. He owned a coffee shop for 10 years until he sold it to his business partner, and he has storage and warehouse buildings he rents out. After he learned about computer software by working at his church, Destin took a class on technology. He said he saw an opportunity for business growth and decided to change industries. 

At the moment, Destin owns one kiosk and says he has the approval to set up in his neighborhood mall. He provides options for clients, including already-made kiosks similar to ones seen at major department stores set to accept job applications - and a way-finder, similar to ones in malls, with informational slides.  “I think what makes my business so unique is that it’s an outlet to release information,” Destin says.  “If you pass a billboard on the street, you may not get all the information, but a kiosk is more intimate. You can read and take it in.”

After hearing about Accion Texas Inc. in a radio ad, Destin applied for a loan to get his business started.  He used the loan to purchase a demo phone-charging kiosk to pitch his business to potential clients. The charging port takes 15 minutes maximum to fully charge a dead smart phone and comes with Android and iPhone connectors. Without the help of Accion, Destin says, the momentum of his business would have slowed down.

Though his business was registered only a year and a half ago, Destin plans to purchase iPads to include in kiosks for doctors’ offices, in which staff can obtain patient information and patients can make payments.  As his business grows, Destin plans to hire staff, but for the time being he employs himself and his wife.  For more information, visit www.kioskkiosktech.com.

loans.use: To purchase a demo kiosk and market his business.

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en: Myagmar is 58 years old and lives with his younger son in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been operating a manufacturing business, making double-glazed windows, with his son in their home province since 2007. In 2010, he built a house for the business. As you know, Mongolia is one of the coldest countries in the world and borders with Siberia to the north. His businessplace is cold and not comfortable. With the loan, he wants to thicken the walls of his businessplace with materials like cement, brick, and glass-wool to stop heat loss; to do interior decoration with energy-saving materials; and to install a low-pressure furnace that releases less harmful chemicals into the atmosphere in order to save the environment. This loan will also be used to install a bio-toilet on the plot of land.

loans.use: to thicken the walls of his business place with materials like cement, brick, and glass-wool to stop heat loss; to do interior decoration with energy-saving materials; and to install a bio-toilet on the plot of land.

loans.name: Muterian

texts.en: Muterian is 58 years old and married. He supports a family of five children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last 10 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. He is servicing his fifth loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, and this will help him prepare the farm and buy farm supplies. He hopes to use his anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dream is to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a 26-year-old married man. He describes himself as hardworking. He operates a retail store where he sells shoe soles and repairs worn-out shoes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is in a viable business area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy shoe soles. His business goal is to be selling new shoes to customers within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will run a bigger retail store.

loans.use: to buy shoe soles.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 35 year old married man and father of three children. He has been working in the agriculture business since 20 years ago. He is specialized in tobacco cultivation as his main source of a living. He is an expert in his business, since he plants the best quality tobacco seeds.  The Lebanese government guaranties to buy all the tobacco production from those who work in such cultivation, which encourages a lot of farmers to move into such production.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a car necessary for his business transportation to buy the best seeds and necessary tools.  At the same time, it will provide his family with special facilities through having easy family outings.

This will be  Khaled's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good standing and repayment history. His previous loans where invested in improving, expanding and increasing his production. This increase reflected positively on his family's social and financial situation, which he hopes to keep on being capable of doing.

loans.use: to buy a car that will provide business and family transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar is 28 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. He lives in a ger in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife helps him run his mobile phone repair and sales business. Otgonbaatar graduated from a mobile phone repair course in 2008 and started his business of mobile phone repair business in the local market. 

Otgonbaatar's computer was broken and he temporarily stopped his business. He is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase a new computer and restart his business. He is a hardworking, diligent and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase new computer and restart his mobile repair business.

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is a 41-year-old married woman. She has nine children. She describes herself as a business-oriented woman. 

Kuvuna operates a general store, where she sells items such as firewood, slippers, plasticware, and vegetables such as onions and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Kuvuna will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy plastic items, vegetables, firewood, slippers, etc., for her store. Her business goal is to run a bigger general store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy plasticware, vegetables, firewood, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en:
Hamis began working in transportation one-and-a-half years ago when he saw that in his town he had a great opportunity in this business to generate income. Thus he began working in this activity, which generates the income he needs for the household expenses of his wife and their two children, who are 1-1/2 years, and 1 month old.

The greatest difficulty that Hamis faces is his small amount of capital, and now that he needs cash, he is searching for a loan in order to repair his motorcycle engine and to have his motorcycle completely serviced.

This would allow him to offer better service to his customers, and his income would continue to increase little by little. His dream is to provide a more stable home for his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle engine and to have his motorcycle completely serviced.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 39 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 9 years old. She owns a business selling various goods such as rice, sugar, lotions, soap, and toothpaste. She has one year of experience. Her business is open from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day except Sunday. Mediatrice currently employs one person to help her. 
Mediatrice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods for resale, such as soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soft  drinks. Through this expansion, Mediatrice will be able to earn more profit, which will be used to expand her general store and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase goods for resale such as soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soft  drinks.

loans.name: Shallet

texts.en:
Shallet is a hard-working woman who loves to pull ahead every day for her family. She is a humble and simple person. Shallet lives with her husband and five children in the rural town of Kaloleni. 

She works selling vegetables and dried fish in a small stall located outside her home. This income is vital to helping Shallet support her family. 

She has currently requested a loan from Yehu that she will use to buy merchandise like onions, tomatoes, kale, and dried fish to sell. The investment will increase her stock, sales and income. Shallet dreams of having a store where she can offer her products.

loans.use:
to buy merchandise like onions, tomatoes, kale, and dried 
fish to sell.

loans.name: Silan

texts.en:
Silan is a 20-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He sells perfumes and cosmetic materials. He has been operating his business for 2 years. He started his business with his father providing to open his business. He has very good references from his clients who say they are very satisfied with the service he provides.

Every day he makes a greater effort because his dream is to be able to give himself a better quality of life. He has been thinking about growing his business and for this reason he decided to apply for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of products such as perfumes, cosmetic materials, etc. He has noticed that these products are in high demand and wishes to put emphasis on them in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as perfumes, cosmetic materials, etc. for his business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years old, married and, has one child. She describes herself as a business-oriented woman. She operates a food stall  where she sells food, snacks, and tea, which she has been doing for three years. Her business is located within a highly populated area and her primary customers are residents from the neighborhood. 

Margaret is requesting her first loan from SMEP DTM for 10,000 KES, which she will use to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. Her business goal is to run a hotel within five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a 58-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband have been engaged in a rice farming business for more than 15 years now. She helps her husband with tilling.

Belen wants to expand their farming business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, she joined CEVI to gain access to financial support through loans offered by the organization to microentrepreneurs like her. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she and her husband will be able to grow healthy crops, thus giving them a good harvest. In the future, Belen dreams of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Matoe

texts.en:
Matoe is 49 years old, single, and has seven children, one of whom attends school. She lives in Air Port Community. For the past 30 years, she has been selling rice, cement, and lappa (traditional cloths) in her community. 

Matoe is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more rice, cement, and lappa for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cement, and lappa.

loans.name: Layale

texts.en:
Layale is a 28-year-old single Lebanese woman. She lives with her parents and three siblings, who attend school. 

Layale has worked as a private teacher since 2008. She likes her job because she feels that she is helping learners to get a needed education. She also works as a teacher in a local school to supplement her income. Her father is the family's main source of income, and they cooperate to gather enough money to be able to pay the large expenses of life. 

Today, Layale is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to arrange a special room in her house to receive her students at home and to equip it with the needed materials. She notes that these purchases will facilitate her work preparation. She is very optimistic and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to arrange a special room in her house for teaching and to equip it with needed materials

loans.name: Jamolbi

texts.ru: Чамолби проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Муж Чамолби работает в городе Душанбе, он повар. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Чамолби имеет средне - специальное образование, она портниха. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается десять лет. Чамолби берет кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки и покупки тканей.
texts.en: Jamolbi lives in Kulob in Tajikisan. She is 38 years old, married and has three children. Jamolbi's husband works in Dushanbe as a cook and her children are in middle school. Jamolbi herself has a professional degree as a seamstress and sews Tajik national dresses from home. She has been working as a seamstress for ten years. Jamolbi is taking out this loan to purchase a new sewing machine and a batch of fabrics for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Annabelle Gisella

texts.es:
Annabelle Gisella tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos  vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
ESTA VRC SAN ANTONIO, SUS MIEMBROS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA TODOS VIVEN EN EL SECTOR DEL RECINTO AGUAS FRIAS. PRACTICAMENTE SE HAN CRIADO EN ESA ZONA, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIAS EN SU MAYORIA.
Gisella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cacao y la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas y balanceados de crianza y engorde para los animales. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas de. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventana.
El sueño es comprar más terreno para aumentar la producción. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades de los cultivos y animales. En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir reuniones con los amigos e ir a misa los domingos.
texts.en:
Annabelle Gisella is 37 years old, married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas in De Los Rios province.

The members of the San Antonio communal bank work in agriculture. They all live around the rural settlement of Aguas Frias. Almost all of them have grown up in that area, and the majority work in agriculture and livestock-raising.

Gisella is a farmer; growing corn, cacao and raising chickens and pigs. She is applying for the loan in order to buy insecticides, urea, herbicides, and balanced feed for raising her animals. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy seeds. She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to buy more land in order to increase her output. The challenges she faces are crop and animal diseases. In her free time she likes to get together with friends and to go to mass on Sundays.

loans.use: To buy insecticides, urea, herbicides, and balanced feed for fattening her animals.

loans.name: Natividad Evelina

texts.es:
Natividad Evelina tiene 46 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos  vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
ESTA VRC SAN ANTONIO, SUS MIEMBROS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA TODOS VIVEN EN EL SECTOR DEL RECINTO AGUAS FRIAS. PRACTICAMENTE SE HAN CRIADO EN ESA ZONA, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIAS EN SU MAYORIA.
Natividad se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cacao y la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas y balanceados de crianza y engorde para los animales. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas de. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventana.
El sueño es comprar terrenos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades de los cultivos y animales. En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir reuniones con los amigos e ir a misa los domingos.
texts.en:
Natividad Evelina, 46, is single and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s in the “San Antonio” communal bank whose members all live in the Recinto Aguas Frías sector; they have practically been raised in this zone and they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Natividad works growing corn and cocoa beans and raising chickens and pigs.  She’s requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea, herbicide and animal feed to fatten up the animals.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy seeds.  She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  Her dream is to buy land.  The challenge she faces is crop and animal illnesses.  In her free time she likes getting together with friends and to go to Mass on Sundays.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, herbicide and animal feed.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica tiene 25 años, 5 compartiendo una vida conyugal con Gabriel, por ahora no tienen hijos debido a que desean establecerse como familia y tener las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de sus futuros retoños.
Tiene 5 años dedicándose a la producción integral de cacao orgánico en unas parcelas que adquirió con apoyo de sus padres desde muy joven, posteriormente logro expandir la capacidad de sus terrenos con ayuda de Gabriel para así consolidar su producción y por consiguiente su economía. Desarrolla sus tareas conjuntamente con su pareja y en ocasiones convoca a jornaleros especialmente para el mantenimiento y deshierbo por ser una actividad muy ardua y de trabajo colectivo añadiéndole a ello una gota de cuidado que se debe tener para realizar dichos trabajos.
Lo motivador según considera ella es percibir las ganancias finales que se obtienen ya que es símbolo del arduo trabajo aplicado.
Hace poco logro con tanto esfuerzo adquirir una parcela adicional colindante a la suya en la cual planea expandir sus plantaciones de cacao para el cual es necesario contar con plantas de almácigo, abono orgánico, mano de obra  adicionlandole el sembrado de árboles para  sombra temporal como son árboles de plátano y otros.
Tiene bien orientados sus objetivos puesto que uno de sus sueños es el de adquirir un lote para vivienda en la parte urbana de su localidad forjando así un buen porvenir para sus hijos. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, desde ya agradece por la confianza brindada puesto que inició cuando tenía inconvenientes con sus cultivos y fueron de gran ayuda para solucionarlos. Muestra su total confianza frente a su grupo comuna ya que los integrantes en su totalidad son personas que ella conoce desde muy niña.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles iniciara la expansión de sus plantaciones con la compra de plantas de almácigo , abono orgánico y mano de obra por parte de los jornaleros.
texts.en:
Yessica, 25, has been sharing her life with Gabriel for five years but they don’t have any children yet because they want to be established as a family first and have the basic conditions necessary for their future children’s comfort.  She’s been working for five years growing organic cocoa beans on land she got with support from her parents when she was very young.  She later managed to expand the capacity of her fields with Gabriel’s help in order to consolidate her production and thus her income.  She does the tasks alongside her spouse and sometimes hires day laborers especially for maintenance and weeding because this is very hard work that has to be done collectively with a drop of care added to do said chores.  According to her, the motivator is the final profits earned since they symbolize the hard work applied.

A short time ago thanks to much effort she was able to acquire an additional parcel adjacent to hers she plans to expand her cocoa bean crops into and to do so needs to have seedlings, organic manure and additional manpower to plant shade trees like banana trees and others.  Her objectives are well-drawn out because one of her plans is to acquire an urban lot for housing thus forging a better future for her children.

This is her 5th MFP loan and she gives thanks in advance for the trust placed in her because when she started out she had some obstacles with her crops and they were of great help for her solving them.  She totally trusts her communal group because all the members without exception are people she’s known since she was a little girl.  She will use the 2,000 new soles to expand her crops; she will buy seedlings, organic manure and pay to hire day laborers.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, sacks of organic manure and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Irlanda Otilia

texts.es:
Irlanda Otilia tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil Soltera  tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos  vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
ESTA VRC SAN ANTONIO, SUS MIEMBROS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA TODOS VIVEN EN EL SECTOR DEL RECINTO AGUAS FRIAS. PRACTICAMENTE SE HAN CRIADO EN ESA ZONA, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIAS EN SU MAYORIA.
Irlanda  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de cerdos, gallinas y patos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas y balanceados de crianza y engorde para los animales. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas de. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventana.
El sueño es comprar terrenos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades de los cultivos y animales. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar tiempo con los hijos caminando y conversando.
texts.en:
Irlanda Otilia, 40, is single and has three children.  She lives with her children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s in the “San Antonio” communal bank whose members all live in the Recinto Aguas Frías sector; they have practically been raised in this zone and they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Irlanda works growing corn and cocoa beans and raising chickens, ducks and pigs.  She’s requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea, herbicide and animal feed to fatten up the animals.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy seeds.  She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  Her dream is to buy land.  The challenge she faces is crop and animal illnesses.  In her free time she likes spending time with her children chatting and going for walks.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, herbicide and animal feed.

loans.name: Oswaldo Rodolfo

texts.es:
Oswaldo Rodolfo tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil Casado tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos  vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
ESTA VRC SAN ANTONIO, SUS MIEMBROS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA TODOS VIVEN EN EL SECTOR DEL RECINTO AGUAS FRIAS. PRACTICAMENTE SE HAN CRIADO EN ESA ZONA, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIAS EN SU MAYORIA.
Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de cerdos, gallinas y patos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas y balanceados de crianza y engorde para los animales. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas de. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventana.
El sueño es comprar un vehículo. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades de los cultivos y animales. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver la novela en la televisión.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Rodolfo is 33 years old, married, and has four children. He lives with his children in the city of Ventanas in De Los Rios province. 

The members of the San Antonio communal bank work in agriculture. They all live around the rural settlement of Aguas Frias. Almost all of them have grown up in that area, and the majority work in agriculture and livestock-raising.

He farms; growing corn, and raising pigs, hens and ducks.

He is applying for the loan in order to buy insecticides, urea, herbicides and balanced feed for fattening his animals. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy seeds. 

He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to buy a vehicle. The challenges that he faces are crop and animal diseases. In his free time, he likes to watch soap operas on television.

loans.use: To buy insecticides, urea, herbicides, and balanced feed for fattening his animals.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 36-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 to 9 years. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a photography business where he takes customer's pictures. He has been involved in this business for 9 years. His business is located within a busy town  and his primary customers are wedding couples. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that sometimes he uses his cellphone to take pictures due to insufficient funds for buying a camera.

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a printing machine for the pictures. His business goal is to run a photo studio within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a printing machine

loans.name: Shuhudia

texts.en:
Shuhudia is a married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 6 to 27 years. She describes herself to be responsible, social and a customer-friendly woman. She operates a motorcycle which she uses to provide transportation services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located within a busy environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payment from customers.

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle so as to meet the increasing high demands for transportation by her customers. Her business goal is to own a vehicle within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will improve the living standard of her family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Purevhuu

texts.en:
Purevhuu is a 52-year-old woman who lives with her two children in a ger in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. She is a hardworking and welcoming person. Her daughter, Byamba-Erdene, age 23, helps her mother to run her retail business. Her older son is married and lives apart from them, and her son Lhanaajav, age 20, studies at university. 

Purevhuu has been running a retail business selling gum, cigarettes and candy products outside of schools and other crowded places. She is starting a general store at a rental counter of the local market. She is asking for 1,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory for this new general store. She has already found a better rental counter and has spoken with the previous renter.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for starting a new general store in the local market

loans.name: Tania

texts.en: Tania is a 38-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s single, living with her parents and only one working sibling. She, together with her youngest sibling and her father, manages the family’s household expenses. They are all working nonstop to enhance their way of living.  Meanwhile Tania operates her own business. She wishes to bring added income to her family; that’s why she started her own home business as a private teacher. Her students visit her from all the neighboring villages. She’s well known for her high professionalism. Today, she’s asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a laptop and a new photocopy machine. In that way, she will be capable to better develop her work and deliver the information in a good way. This is how Tania works every day to enhance her life and better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and a new photocopy machine

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old man. He’s Lebanese and single. He lives with his parents and three siblings. He receives great support from his father and both are trying their best to live a respectable life. 

Mohammad owns a honey bee farm. He raises a fair number of bees from which he obtains honey. He sells the honey to his loyal customers, who always ask for his good-quality products. Despite his age, Mohammad knows very well how to manage his work in a good way. He’s really good in his domain and looks forward to developing his business as much as he can. For this reason, he wants to take a youth loan form Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a larger quantity of bees. In his opinion, this step will allow him to increase his productivity and therefore his earnings and his whole way of living.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of bees

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a single Lebanese man. He’s 30 years old. He’s really close to his one parent and is trying his best to offer him a respectable life. Cooperating together, Mostafa and his parent are capable of covering their large life expenses for a better future. 

Mostafa started his business at an early age. He had to work with high professionalism to prove that he’s a dependable man. He started his own work in 2008. He has been working as a car painter in his own garage and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy additional tools and painting supplies for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attracting more customers. In the future, he plans to open his own car painting shop.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and painting supplies for his business

loans.name: Bylent

texts.en:
Bylent is thirty-seven years old, married and has only one child. He lives in the western part of Kosovo. Bylent is a hard worker and a very responsible person. For more than one year now he has opened and operated a small restaurant where he makes breakfast, lunch and dinner. He serves chicken, kebab, soups, and other dishes and usually works from 08:00 until 20:00. 

His restaurant is situated in a place where there are a lot of people around, similar to being in a center, which helps him to get a lot of customers. He is requesting the loan amount to pay for inventory for his restaurant. The loan will help him to increase his income. Bylent hopes in the future to get more income and expand into a larger restaurant. He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments according to the schedule. He is grateful to all kiva lenders!

loans.use: To pay for inventory for his restaurant

loans.name: Rabiha

texts.en:
Rabiha is a 53-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband, a modest farmer who strives to work really hard in order to cover his family's expenses. With the cooperation of Rabiha, they are capable of satisfying their needs. 

As for Rabiha, she owns a minimarket where she sells all kinds of dairy and everyday products in addition to soft drinks and many other products. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase stocks of food for her minimarket. In this way she will be able to diversify her items and therefore increase her revenues and improve her family's way of living. She looks forward to expanding her grocery, waiting for the perfect time to open other branches and assign these branches’ ownership to others.

loans.use: to purchase food for her minimarket

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 32-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and looks forward to getting married and having children. Currently, he is living with his parent and one sibling. With his working parent and the support of his sibling, Kassem is capable of managing the family’s household in order to improve their way of living. 

Kassem had many years of experience in repairing vehicle wheels before he decided to open his own garage. And as he wishes to better develop his work, he is asking today for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed tools and renovate his shop. This step will facilitate his business, allowing him to receive more clients and serve them rapidly. Kassem has just started his career; that’s why a Kiva loan will be way good for him to expand his business and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase tools and renovate his shop

loans.name: Together As One Ii Group

texts.en:
Amadu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Amadu was born in Makeni city, in Northern Sierra Leone, 35 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has three children, who are attending primary school.

For 10 years now, Amadu has been selling used clothes. This is the first loan that he and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Amadu will use his share of the loan (300,000 Leones) to expand his business; he will buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Angel Adrian

texts.es:
Angel Adrian tiene 26 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo  vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

ESTA VRC SAN ANTONIO, SUS MIEMBROS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA TODOS VIVEN EN EL SECTOR DEL RECINTO AGUAS FRIAS. PRACTICAMENTE SE HAN CRIADO EN ESA ZONA, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIAS EN SU MAYORIA.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas y balanceados de crianza y engorde para los animales. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas de. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventana.

El sueño es comprar terrenos para construir la casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades de los cultivos y animales. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deportes con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Angel Adrian, 26, is in a civil union and has a son.  He lives with his wife and son in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s in the “San Antonio” communal bank whose members all live in the Recinto Aguas Frías sector; they have practically been raised in this zone and they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Angel works growing corn and cocoa beans and raising chickens.  He’s requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea, herbicide and animal feed to fatten up the animals.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy seeds.  He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  His dream is to buy land to build his house.  The challenge he faces is crop and animal illnesses.  In his free time he likes to play sports with his friends in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, herbicide and animal feed.

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es:
Carlos Julio tiene 20 años de edad de estado civil Soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres  vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
ESTA VRC SAN ANTONIO, SUS MIEMBROS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA TODOS VIVEN EN EL SECTOR DEL RECINTO AGUAS FRIAS. PRACTICAMENTE SE HAN CRIADO EN ESA ZONA, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIAS EN SU MAYORIA.
Carlos Julio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas y balanceados de crianza y engorde para los animales. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas de. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventana.
El sueño es comprar terrenos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades de los cultivos y animales. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirse con los amigos para conversar.
texts.en:
Carlos Julio, 20, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s in the “San Antonio” communal bank whose members all live in the Recinto Aguas Frías sector; they have practically been raised in this zone and they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Carlos Julio works growing corn and cocoa beans and raising pigs.  He’s requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea, herbicide and animal feed to fatten up the animals.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy seeds.  He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  His dream is to buy land.  The challenge he faces is crop and animal illnesses.  In his free time he likes getting together with his friends to chat.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, herbicide and animal feed.

loans.name: Elba Jenny

texts.es:
Elba  tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos  vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
ESTA VRC SAN ANTONIO, SUS MIEMBROS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA TODOS VIVEN EN EL SECTOR DEL RECINTO AGUAS FRIAS. PRACTICAMENTE SE HAN CRIADO EN ESA ZONA, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIAS EN SU MAYORIA.
Elba  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas de. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventana.
El sueño es comprar terrenos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades de los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Elba, 40, is in a free civil union and has four children; she lives with her children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s in the “San Antonio” communal bank whose members all live in the Recinto Aguas Frías Sector; they’ve practically been raised there and they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Elba works growing corn and rice.  She’s requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea and herbicide.  With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy seeds.  She will make her purchases in Ventanas.  Her dream is to buy land.  The challenge she faces is crop illnesses.  In her free time she likes playing sports.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea and herbicide.

loans.name: Claudio Aniceto

texts.es:
Claudio  tiene 42 años de edad de estado civil Soltero tiene un hijo, vive con los hijos  vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
ESTA VRC SAN ANTONIO, SUS MIEMBROS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA TODOS VIVEN EN EL SECTOR DEL RECINTO AGUAS FRIAS. PRACTICAMENTE SE HAN CRIADO EN ESA ZONA, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIAS EN SU MAYORIA.
Claudio  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas de. Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventana.
El sueño es ponerse un negocio de venta de ropa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades de los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir a l rio.
texts.en:
Claudio, 42, is single and has a son.  He lives with his son in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s in the “San Antonio” communal bank whose members all live in the Recinto Aguas Frías sector; they have practically been raised in this zone and they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Carlos Julio works growing corn and rice.  He’s requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea and herbicide.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy seeds.  He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  His dream is to start a business selling clothes.  The challenge he faces is crop illnesses.  In his free time he likes going to the river.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea and herbicide.

loans.name: Bubuharia

texts.ru: Бубухария 50 лет, имеет 4 детей. После развала союза Бубухария получила свою долю колхозной земли, 25 лет назад Бубухария в качестве основного дохода начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, стартовав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бубухария в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 бычок ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 20,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубухария обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы . Доходы от кредита Бубухария планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. В дальнейшем она планирует построить дом в селе для сына. Чтобы под старость лет спокойно смотреть за внуками.
texts.en:
Bubuhariya 50 years and has 4 children. After the collapse of the Soviet Union Bubuhariya got her share of collective farm land, 25 years ago as her main source of income, Bubuhariya started engaging in animal husbandry and field crop cultivation, having started this business with the amount of 10.000 KGS. 

Through hard work in her business Bubuhariya today has one bull and monthly income from the business is about 20,000 KGS. In order to further develop her business, Bubuhariya turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100.000 som (KGS) for the purchase of milk cows. Proceeds from loan Bubuhariya plans to invest in further increasing the number of livestock. In the future, she plans to build a house in the village for her son so that under the old age she can quietly look after her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Oyunjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunjargal is a 30-year-old single woman who lives with her grandmother in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic felt housing tent, similar to a yurt)	in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her grandmother is a 72-year-old lady who requires constant care. She has been running a business of clothes retailing since 2000 with her sister, and from 2005 she has been running a clothes retailing business alone for her living at a rental counter at a local market.

She has temporarily stopped her business for the last few months because of her grandmother's health condition. She spent her cash for her grandmother's hospital expenses and needed additional cash of 1,000,000 MNT to import clothes from Erlian, China to run her clothes retailing business again from her rental counter at a local market. She is a hardworking, kind and responsible woman.

loans.use: to import clothes from Erlian, China to run her clothes retailing business again from her rental counter at a local market

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 33-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and four children, who attend school. Fadia faced bad circumstances and lived in unpleasant financial conditions. That’s why she has struggled and worked hard to be able to enhance her family’s way of living. She’s a great support for her husband, who is their main income provider. He has owned a spare car parts shop since 2000.  

Fadia opened a clothing shop in 2006, where she offers a great variety of clothes at good prices. This will be her third Kiva loan and she is very thankful for the results attained so far thanks to the previous loans. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashion. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and thus her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes for her shop

loans.name: Thaimu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Thaimu, a married father of three children aged two, four and seven, the latter of whom is attending school. He has two additional dependents who live with him, his younger sisters whose education he is assisting with.

In 2002, Thaimu established his used clothing business in order to be self-reliant. His enterprise is located in a busy market area, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,596,000 every month.

Having already received and repaid three loans, Thaimu is requesting a new one for Le 5,000,000 to increase his stock of used vests, blouses, T-shirts and jeans in order to increase his profits. In the future, he plans to open outlets on the outskirts of town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for vests, blouses, T-shirts and jeans

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Joseph.  He is married and has two children, aged eight and three, who both attend school. In 2007, Joseph established his cinema business. The business was started to help a late brother after coming from the provinces. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are all ages and sexes.

Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,126,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.  Joseph requires a loan in order to improve a side shop in the same building for the sale of drinks. He hopes that the loan can help to start the drinks sales business. In the future, Joseph plans to expand the business with the sale of drinks.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks

loans.name: L'union De Senzidor Group

texts.fr:
Danie est le coordinateur de son groupe l`union de senzidor. Il habite dans la région nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Il a dirigé son commerce de vente de produit divers durant les 4 dernières années. Il a 2 enfants.

Avant de commencer ce commerce, Il etait un enseignant Danie voudrait utiliser cet emprunt dans l'achat des cosmetiques, vetement, chaussures. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de l`union de senzidor ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmétiques et charbon. 

Danie dit que son défi principal il n y a pas des acheteurs constants et vente credit qui lui rend difícil. Il dit que son rêve c`est d`avoir un plus grand grand dans Esperanza pour obtenir un plus grand commere.
texts.en:
Danie is the coordinator of his group Union of Senzidor. He lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is scarce and water supplies are limited. He has been running a business selling various products for the past four years. He has two children. Prior to this activity, he used to be a teacher. 

Danie will use this loan to buy cosmetic products, clothing and footwear. He hopes that this credit will help him to achieve his goal of expanding his activity.  

Other members of Union of Senzidor require a loan for activities such as the sale of food, cosmetic products and charcoal. Danie’s main challenge is the lack of repeat customers. Selling on credit also makes things difficult for him. His dream is to expand his business with more help from Esperanza.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, clothing and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María indudablemente es una persona de admiración, siempre con una sonrisa y alegría que le caracteriza, ella se define como una persona, paciente humilde y muy trabajadora. Ama a su esposo y a su joven hijo de 13 años 


El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a invertir en la compra de animales como cerdos y borregos, para la crianza y la venta de los mismos, esta es una oportunidad que María ve ya que tiene el terreno y las instalaciones adecuadas para su crianza, esta inversión le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de María es poder tener una pequeña finca en su terreno para tener mayor diversidad de animales de granja para criarlos y venderlos, y con estos ingresos mejorar su casa y darle la educación a su hijo, María tiene fe que con trabajo y amor su sueño se cumplirá.
texts.en:
Without a doubt, María is an admirable person; always with the smile and joy that so characterize her, she defines herself as a humble, patient, very hardworking person.  She loves her husband and her 13-year-old son.

The loan she’s asking from Fodemi is to buy animals like pigs and sheep to raise and then sell.  This is an opportunity María has because she has land and adequate installations to care for them.  This investment will help her increase her income and improve her quality of life.

María’s dream is to be able to have a small farm on her land to have a wider variety of farm animals to raise and sell and use income to improve her house and provide education for her son.  María has faith that with work and love her dream will become reality.

loans.use: to buy pigs and sheep.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: María Elsa de 69 anos de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad e independiente, ella es originaria del departamento de  Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. María Elsa tiene por actividad económica la venta de especies sirven par condimentar las comidas como (CANELA, PIMIENTA, ANIS, RODAMINA, ANELINA, CLAVO DE OLOR,) tiene 16 anos de vender del producto, vende de forma ambulante en los diferentes municipios. María  Elsa se ha caracterizado por ser luchadora, responsable, trabajadora, la Sra., ya ha tenido crédito con fundación el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo  y forma. El objetivo del préstamo en invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar especies al por mayor y aprovechar los descuentos, y así tener suficientes mercadería par ofrecer a sus clientes. María Elsa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en: María Elsa is 69 years old, she is married and she has two adult children who are economically independent. She comes from Chinandega, a department located in the west of the country. María Elsa is a retailer, selling spices to flavor food such as cinnamon, pepper, anise, rue, vanilla, and cloves. She is a street vendor selling her products in different towns, and she has been engaged in this activity for 16 years. María Elsa is known for being a resourceful, responsible and hardworking woman. She has already received loans form the institution and she has proven herself to be responsibly respecting her repayment’s schedule and methods. The loan she is now requesting will be invested in her activity making the most of discounts by buying spices at wholesale price, in order to have enough products to offer to her customers. María Elsa is grateful for the chance of having a dignified source of income that Kiva lenders offer to people with meager resources and living in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: To buy spices such as cinammon, pepper, anise, rue, vanilla and cloves.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es: G.S. LA UNION  esta conformado por dos integrantes  Osmar Y Rigoberto los cuales se unieron para ayudarse mutuamente y ser beneficiado por el prestamos en sus diferentes actividades económicas. Ellos son personas responsables, trabajadoras, de buenas costumbres. Osmar es el coordinador de grupo solidario el cual se encarga de las responsabilidad del mismo en cuanto a los pagos, él tiene por actividad económica la venta de pan de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación desde hace 20 anos. Él ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 lo cual le ha ayudado a crecer en su negocio. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir sus canastos de pan dulce, pan simple,pan cortado, pan de especies, para ofrecer mejor servicios a sus clientes. Los integrantes del grupo solidario LA UNION agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The borrower group "LA UNION" [The Union] is made up of two members.  Osmar and Rigoberte formed a group together in order to mutually help one another and to benefit from the loans in their different economic activities.  They are responsible, hard-working, and well-mannered people.

Osmar is the coordinator of this borrower group and undertakes the liability of the party in terms of payments.  He sells bread by walking door to door and also from his own home; he has been doing this for twenty years.  

He has already worked with the Fundación león 2000; it has helped him to grow his business.  The financing he needs is to invest in working capital and to fill his baskets with sweet bread, regular bread, sliced bread, and spiced bread in order to offer the best services to his customers. 

The members of the borrower group LA UNION are thankful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people with scarce resources in poor countries, like Nicaragua, in order to have decent work.

loans.use: to purchase sweet bread, regular bread, sliced bread, and spiced bread in order to offer the best services to his customers

loans.name: Jesus & Jessica

texts.en:
Jesus and his daughter Jessica are the owners of a jewelry repair business in San Diego. Jesus learned the skill of fixing antique watches and clocks back in Mexico, their home country. He has over 20 years of experience in the industry.  

After working for a jewelry store in San Diego for 12 years, he was laid off during the recent recession. With no hopes of finding a job within his industry, he decided to take a job as a janitor in the evenings. The job gave him and his family a stable source of income and allowed him to try to start his own jewelry repair business from home.

Jesus now operates the business together with his daughter from a small store front location. During the day, Jesus teaches his daughter the precise skills required for watch repair, with the dream that she can one day take over the business.

He still maintains his janitor job in the evenings, working many hours each day to continue to grow and further improve the life of his family. 

Their $5,000 Kiva loan will give Jesus and Jessica the opportunity to purchase extra inventory so they can diversify their product and service offerings in time for the holiday season. They will also be able to purchase an engraving machine, which will generate extra income.

loans.use: to purchase holiday inventory and an engraving machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Las ganas y la motivación de superarse es uno de los sueños mas grandes de una joven mujer  que vive junto a su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, entre otros, ya tiene algún tiempo con el negocio y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad del producto, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor todos los días lucha por conseguir un futuro mejor con nuevos horizontes y alejada de la delincuencia, de la que es victima la localidad en que vive, día a día se esta esforzando al máximo pues esta feliz con su trabajo y no quiere decepcionar a su familia, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda del producto y necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, pan, bebidas, etc. La joven tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, se siente satisfecha con la ayuda y asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda,  a la vez confía que podrá llevar a su pequeño hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The desire and motivation to improve is one of the biggest dreams of a young woman who lives with her family.  She has a shop where she sells essentials like basic grains, milk, and eggs among other items. She has already had some time with the business and it has given her valuable experience in sales which allows her to get the best income.  The shop is well-known by the people in the town and already has many customers that prefer it for the quality of the products, the good prices, and the excellent service. 

She is an enterprising woman; dedicated to her work every day, fighting to get a better future with new horizons and away from the crime of which the town she lives in is a victim.  Day to day she tries her hardest so she is happy with her work and does not want to disappoint her family.  In the last weeks the demand for her products have increased and she needs to make a new investment, which is why she asks for a loan that will allow her to buy basic grains, instant products, candies, bread, drinks, etc.  The young woman has good pay references and is very responsible.  She is satisfied with the help and is certain that she will be able to settle the debt.  At the same time she trusts that she will be able to bring financial security to her small home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, candies, bread, and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El deseo de superarse es uno de los sueños mas importantes de esta mujer que vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia, quiere tener un nuevo comienzo y evitar así cualquier contacto con la delincuencia que tiene invadido el lugar donde reside, además desea salir de la pobreza dando lo mejor de sus capacidades, es una de las mejores decisiones que ha tomado y se siente orgullosa de eso, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de forma ambulante, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, por los precios accesibles y sobre todo por el servicio excelente, es una mujer activa, emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, y con muchos sueños que desea lograr, esta trabajando duro por alcanzar un futuro mas prospero, se siente muy contenta con su trabajo, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por lo que quiere realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez  que llevará a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The desire to improve is one of the most important dreams of this woman who lives with her family in their own home.  She wants to have a new beginning and thus avoid any contact with the crime that has invaded the town where she lives.  Additionally, she wants to get out of poverty to the best of her ability, and this is one of the best decisions that she has made and she is proud of it.  

She makes a living selling underwear as a street vendor.  She already has many customers who prefer her for the quality, the attainable prices, and above all, the excellent service.  She is an acitve woman, enterprising, dedicated to her work, and has many dreams that she wishes to achieve.  She works hard to reach a more prosperous future, and is pleased with her work. 

In the last weeks the demand for her products has increased so she wants to make a new investment, which is why she asks for a loan that will allow her to buy wholesale clothing.  She has good pay references and is very responsible; certain that she will be able to settle the debt and at the same time bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to buy underwear for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Esta joven mujer esta empezando un negocio de venta de artículos de uso personal cosméticos, cremas, lociones, entre otros, quiere tener un nuevo comienzo y dejar la vida de delincuencia es una de las mejores y mas grandes decisiones que ha tomado y su grupo familiar esta dispuesto a darle su apoyo, comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar en  la localidad donde vive, ha adquirido experiencia en las ventas y eso le permite obtener buenas ganancias, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad, los precios accesibles y el excelente servicio; es una mujer activa, emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, luchadora y con muchas metas que desea lograr, esta trabajando duro por alcanzar un futuro mas prospero, se siente muy contenta con el negocio, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda por lo que quiere realizar una nueva inversión por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar lociones, cremas cosméticos. La joven tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevará a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para a todos.
texts.en:
This young woman is starting a business of selling personal use products like cosmetics, creams, and lotions, among others.  She wants to have a new start and to leave the life of crime, which is one of the best and biggest decisions that she has made and her family is ready to give her support.  She makes sales as a street vendor and from her home in the town where she lives.  She has acquired experience in sales and this allows her to make a good earning.  She has gotten many customers because the people prefer her for the quality, attainable prices, and excellent service.  

She is an active woman, enterprising, dedicated to her work, and a fighter with many goals that she wants to achieve.  She is working hard to reach a more prosperous future and is very happy with the business.  In the last weeks the demand has increased so she wants to make a new investment, and for this she asks INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy lotions, creams, and costmetics.  The young woman has good pay references and is responsible.  She promises to settle the debt and at the same time has hope that she will bring home financial security and a better quality of life for everyone.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ramon Alfonso

texts.es:
Ramón de 58 años, soltero, padre de 3 hijos, de oficio agricultor, con estudio básico  de primaria. Se dedica a procesar el achote y  luego lo  vende  como una especie de  condimento que  usan para cocinar, con el tiempo se dio cuenta que le salía más rentable sembrar y vender este producto, ya empacado a sus clientes,  el  comercializar sus productos  en el  Municipios de  Palacaguina . 
El cuenta con otros ingresos como es la venta de limones y banano. Sus expectativas es ampliar el área de siembra  en donde cultiva sus limones,bananos y achotes ya que el considera que este negocio le genera mas ingresos. 
 
Ramón solicita este crédito para pagar mano de obra y comprar insumo como abono, fertilizantes, etc para utilizarlo en su siembras. El estima que este préstamo le ayudara para el mantenimiento adecuado de su cosecha de achote, de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias en la producción.
texts.en: Ramón is 58 years old, single, and the father of three children. He is a farmer, and has completed basic primary school studies. He works processing achote (annatto), and sells it as a seasoning to be used in cooking. He realized that annatto was his most profitable plant, and packages his product to be sold to clients in the municipalities of Palacaguina. He also generates income by selling lemons and bananas. Ramón's goals are to increase the planting area in which he grows his lemons, bananas, and annatto, in order for this part of his business to generate more income. Ramón is applying for this loan to pay for labor and to purchase supplies such as manure, fertilizers, etc. to use for planting. He believes this loan will help him to adequately maintain his annatto harvest, and in this way, increase production

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase supplies such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 23-year-old single woman, who has been working as a tutor since six years ago. Zahraa enjoys her work a lot and she is working hard on improving and developing it as much as she can.

She is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to  buy a laptop necessary for her business development. She will use it in providing her students visual explanations and necessary examples to make learning easier for them. She is hoping that one day in the future she will open her own special education center and provide the students special educating tools that will make them enjoy being educated.

This is her first experience as Al Majmoua borrower; she hopes her future relationship will be based on making her dream come true.

loans.use: To buy a laptop necessary for her business development

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 45 years old. She lives in the Lagodekhi District of East Georgia with her husband, who works as a frontier guard and gets a monthly income. Lali grows ornamental plants on the family-owned land, such as: box trees, fir trees and cypress. She sells ornamental saplings at the local open market. 

She has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was always rejected, due to lack of experience in a new business. Experience is usually demanded by local credit providers. 

Lali requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and re-startup credits with easier conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Lali will purchase used clothing and sell it from her house among her neighbors. She will begin her entrepreneurial activity with a wide assortment of merchandise and high sales volume. This will increase the family's income. 

She wants to develop her business further and reinvest the increased income in trading. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. She is grateful in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for rice, cooking oil, plates, and spoons

loans.name: Batsukh

texts.en:
Mr.Batsukh is 58 years old and lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. His family consists of four people: him, his wife, his 30-year-old son and 25-year-old daughter. His 55-year-old wife is a pensioner who works part time as an assistant at a food store located near their home.

Since 1978, Batsukh has been working as a welder in a local cement factory. In recent years his son has been working with him, while his daughter works as a plasterer. Before Batsukh retires in two years, he wants to build a house and spend the rest of the life there with his wife. Assisted by his children, Batsukh is building a house and is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to complete it.

loans.use: to complete a house

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 28-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 2 and 5. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a tailoring retail store where he repairs worn clothes and sells dresses he makes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within a highly populated area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a sewing machine. His goal is to improve his family's standard of living within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 45 years old. He lives in Martvili District, West Georgia. Avtandil has a large family: a wife, 2 children and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 milk cows whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides, Avtandil has a plot of land where 300 nut trees are growing. Harvested nuts and cheese are sold locally in an open market at a good price.  It is hardly enough for food for such a large family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Avtandil requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the frame of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

As their existing income isn’t enough for the family, and their living conditions are poor, Avtandil decided to work as a taxi driver with his own car. Avtandil needs the requested credit for repairing his own car. Besides, he will purchase 2 pigs and expand his livestock. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to repair his own car and work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda, 27, stopped her education in the 5th grade. Matilda is married, the mother of three children and lives in Congo Town. Her children are between the ages of 11 and 14 and attend school.

For the past five years, she has been selling rice, palm oil, cooking oil, pepper, Vita (a juice drink), onions and tomatoes in the community market. She makes a profit when she sells because her table is located right at the front of the market. She has requested a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, onions, cooking oil and Vita to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to give her children a higher level of education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, onions, cooking oil and Vita to increase her sales

loans.name: Trust And Pay Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Trust and Pay II” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Amie. Amie is age 30. She was born in Kenema city where she is currently residing together with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is a trader  and her children are attending primary and secondary school. For 10 years now,  Amie has been selling palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil). With this loan, Amie will buy gallons of palm oil to add to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is a 50-year-old, married man. He has seven children, whose ages range from 5 years to 17 years. He describes himself as very quiet. He operates a Nissan, with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a rural area, and his customers are mostly residents from the environs. He says his biggest business challenge is the high price of fuel. 

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy spare parts for the Nissan. His business goal is to run a new spare parts retail shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standard of his family with profit generated.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the Nissan

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy slippers and flip-flops wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Mwanate

texts.en: Mwanate is 43 years old, married and has four children. She describes herself as an honest woman. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located within a busy area and her primary customers are residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high taxes. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy cereals to sell. Her business goal is to open a new business selling second-hand clothes within five years. She hopes that in the future she will improve her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals for her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jumber

texts.en:
Jumber is 58 years old and lives in the small village of Tamariani with his wife. The family runs an agricultural business and cultivates family-owned land growing eggplant, cucumbers and maize. The harvested products are sold at the local open market. Jumber also runs a small chemist’s shop and has a monthly income. Several times, he has asked for loans from local financial institutions to start his new business but without success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of income requirements and a lack of experience in new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers.
Jumber’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit. The program extends soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products. They are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Jumber will cover the costs of purchasing his stock of basic groceries for starting a grocery store. He plans to increase the turnover in his trade business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Jumber will work hard and he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family. With this loan, his family will generate enough income to access regular available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event they need it.

loans.use: to purchase stock for starting a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Frank

texts.es:
Frank tiene 34 años de edad, es convivente, y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Amaru Inca perteneciente al Distrito de Tambogrande. Frank vive en la parte rural  de este distrito. Solo cuenta con el servicio básico de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Frank es la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral, los cuales cría engorda y comercializa en el mercado local.  Cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, tiempo en el cual, ha adquirido mayor experiencia y clientes fidelizados.  Con los ingresos que percibe apoya en los gastos de su familia.

Frank desea comprar alimentos balanceados para los animales, además desea realizar mejoras en el corral para así venderlos a un mejor precio y por ende lograr una mejor calidad de vida.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Frank, 34, lives with his partner and has two children.  He lives in his own house, located in the hamlet of Amaru Inca in the district of Tambogrande.  Frank lives in the rural part of this district and has only basic electric service.

Frank's work is raising sheep, pigs, and poultry, which he fattens and sells in the local market.  He has more than eight years of experience managing his business, during which time he has acquired more experience and loyal customers.  With his earnings he helps with the household expenses.

Frank wants to buy balanced feed for the animals.  He also wants to make improvements to the corral so he can sell the animals at a better price, consequently achieving a better quality of life.  This is why he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] to reach his objective.
